Ingredients: 1 fluid ounce Tennessee whiskey (such as Jack Daniels ®)
Directions: Combine amaretto, whiskey, sloe gin, and lemon juice in a cocktail shaker. Add ice and stir until chilled. Strain into chilled cordial glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This potent shooter is best served chilled and slammed all at once, hence its name."

Ingredients: 5 fluid ounces Champagne or other sparkling white wine
Directions: Pour the brandy into a champagne flute. Top with champagne. Gently drop in preserves.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "With a little pear brandy and a bit of fruit compote, this makes a great pre-dinner cocktail. Serve it in a tall champagne flute."

Directions: Pour the vodka and Irish cream into a shot glass. Pour the root beer into a tumbler. Drop the entire shot glass into the root beer and drink immediately.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is not your typical shot. Everyone loves it; it tastes like a root beer float!"

Ingredients: 2 fluid ounces sweet and sour mix
Directions: Pour the vodka, Blue Curacao, and sweet and sour mix to a cocktail shaker filled with ice; shake to chill.
Fill a collins glass with ice; strain the vodka mixture into the glass. Top with a splash of lemon-lime soda.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Good after a hard day's work."

Ingredients: 1 cup ice cubes, or as desired
1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger herbal red wine (such as Dubonnet®)
1/2 fluid ounce orange-flavored liqueur (such as Cointreau®)
1 (1 1/2 inch) piece lemon peel, or more to taste
1 (1 inch) piece orange peel, or more to taste
Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Pour bourbon, herbal red wine, orange-flavored liqueur, and bitters over ice; add lemon peel and orange peel. Cover shaker, shake vigorously to release oils from peels, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This one's like a Manhattan with Dubonnet® and Cointreau® in place of sweet vermouth. Dubonnet® is a fortified red wine, flavored with herbs and fruit and cinchona bark. Rye whiskey can be used in place of bourbon if desired."

Directions: Fill a tumbler with ice, pour in vodka and cola; stir and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Vodka and vanilla cola: like a poor man's black Russian, but lighter."

Ingredients: 1 fluid ounce Canadian whiskey, such as Crown Royal™
1 fluid ounce Kahlua or other coffee flavored liqueur
Directions: Fill a highball glass with ice. Pour in the Canadian whiskey, coffee liqueur and root beer. Slowly pour in the milk so it does not curdle. Stir gently and enjoy immediately.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "My husband's co-worker made us these drinks one night, it is a variation of a paralyzer. They go down much smoother too, so you will not be feeling your legs after a few of these!"

Directions: In a mixing glass, combine the coffee flavored liqueur, vodka and cream or milk. Pour over ice in a highball glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A classic White Russian cocktail made with coffee liqueur, vodka and either cream or milk."

Directions: Place the ice in a glass pitcher. Pour in the Prosecco, orange juice, and cranberry juice; stir. Pour the cocktail into champagne flutes, and sprinkle with lemon zest to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This colorful drink will brighten up any party. Lemon-lime soda can be substituted for the Prosecco for a non-alcoholic version."

Directions: Place strawberries, light rum, and dark rum into a blender. Puree until smooth and pour into a tall glass. Rinse out blender, then puree banana, pineapple juice, and cream of coconut until smooth. Slowly pour the banana mixture into the strawberry mixture and watch the lava rise!
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A fun authentic Hawaiian drink that tastes REALLY good. As you pour in the second mixture, the first will slowly creep up the sides of the glass like lava."

Directions: Place the vodka, butterscotch schnapps, and iced tea into a shaker with the ice. Shake until the shaker has a coating of frost on the outside. Use a squeeze bottle to coat the inside of a martini glass with a spiral of caramel. Strain the liquid from the shaker into the glass and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "For those of us with a sweet tooth. This needs to be served really cold in order to get the flavors to blend. Shake it in a cocktail shaker until it becomes frothy and frosted."

Directions: Fill a rocks glass with ice, and pour in vodka, grain alcohol, and orange juice; stir and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "However you say it, this cocktail will send you soaring!"

Ingredients: 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger creme de menthe liqueur
Directions: Fill an 8 fl. ounce rocks glass with crushed ice. Pour in the shot of creme de menthe and cherry juice, and stir. Toss in the cherry.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A great replacement on the old story that a shot of ginger brandy will cure what ails ya. This is a smooth, cooling drink that you have to try before you comment on it. also known as Xmas in February."

Ingredients: 1 cup ice cubes, or as needed
Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice; add tequila, agave nectar, lime juice, and lemon juice. Cover shaker, shake vigorously, and pour margarita into a glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This margarita is so easy to make and is absolutely refreshing! Add a salted rim and garnish with cilantro to really get the party started!"

Directions: Combine lime juice, triple sec, and vodka in a cocktail shaker. Add ice, cover and shake until chilled. Strain into chilled short glass or cocktail glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "It doesn't get much simpler--or easier to remember--than the recipe for the kamikaze cocktail. Equal parts lime juice, triple sec, and vodka are shaken over ice and served straight up."

Ingredients: 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger Irish cream liqueur
1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger coffee flavored liqueur
Directions: Place ice in a short glass. Pour the Irish cream, butterscotch schnapps, and coffee liquor over the ice. Stir and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A rich, smooth and creamy taste! A slight twist on Irish Cream that everyone will enjoy!"

Directions: Squeeze the lime quarters into a highball glass, and drop the limes into the glass. Add the mint leaves and sugar. Muddle well with the back of a spoon or with a muddler. Place the cucumber slices into the glass, and fill with ice cubes. Pour in the rum, then top off with club soda. Stir gently and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This refreshing version of mint mojitos features a springtime kick of cucumber. We love these at special gatherings and summer barbeques. A pitcher of this can be made a few hours in advance--just add alcohol at serving time."

Directions: Blend ice, strawberries, rum, lime juice, triple sec, and confectioners' sugar in a blender at high speed until smooth, about 30 seconds.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Decorate this blended strawberry daiquiri with a fresh strawberry for an extra presentation touch. Serve in a martini glass with a straw."

Directions: Combine pomegranate juice, vodka, orange liqueur, and ice in a shaker. Add sparkling water and a little lemon juice, if desired. Shake vigorously, and strain into a martini glass. Garnish with pomegranate seeds.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This version features citron vodka, orange liqueur, and pomegranate juice."

Ingredients: 2 fluid ounces club soda, or as needed
Directions: Blend strawberries and raspberries together in a blender until smooth; pour into a tall glass.

Muddle 2 lime wedges and mint together in a separate glass or bowl until broken down; transfer to berry mixture. Add ice cubes and rum to glass. Squeeze the remaining 2 lime wedges over ice, pour in simple syrup, and top with club soda. Stir well.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "After spending $12 per drink at several restaurants, I decided to re-create a fruity mojito at home. You will love this quick, easy and refreshing mojito recipe!"

Directions: Gently stir club soda, rum, lemonade concentrate, lemon juice, and hot sauce together in a pitcher. Pour into glasses filled with crushed ice to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is a very wonderful drink for friends and family get-togethers. Add fresh juice for more tart taste."

Ingredients: 1 fluid ounce dark rum (such as Tres Leones® Red Label)
Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice; pour in passion fruit juice, dark rum, and triple sec. Cover shaker, shake, and strain drink into a champagne glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A fruity cocktail! The combination of rum, triple sec, and passion fruit create a wonderful taste and aroma to enjoy."

Directions: Combine rum, lime juice, maraschino liqueur, and grapefruit juice in a cocktail shaker. Add ice and shake until chilled. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Not so much the drink of Ernest Hemingway, but rather the drink inspired by the author, the Hemingway daiquiri is a sweet and tart rum drink that packs a punch."

Ingredients: 1/2 fluid ounce freshly squeezed lemon juice
1/2 fluid ounce Cointreau or triple sec
Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker 3/4 full with ice cubes. Pour in lemon juice, Cointreau, and brandy. Cover and shake vigorously for about 30 seconds until the outside of the shaker becomes cold and frosty. Strain into a martini glass and garnish with a wedge of lemon.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "I always think of the sidecar as a brandy margarita, except that it is made with fresh lemon juice."

Directions: Pour the vodka, raspberry liqueur, and lime juice into a cocktail shaker over ice. Cover, and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain into a chilled martini glass to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "I came up with this nice variation on a Cosmopolitan."

Directions: Fill a rocks glass with ice, and pour in the vodka, club soda, and lemon-lime soda. Top with a lime twist and serve with a straw.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "One sip, and you'll call this light, refreshing drink 'Fabulous' too!"

Directions: Pour the vodka, coffee liqueur, creme de menthe, and Irish cream into a cocktail shaker over ice. Cover, and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain into a chilled martini glass and garnish with a mint leaf to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This delightful cocktail was a hit at the country club where we had my cousin's bridal shower. As soon they tasted mine, everyone was up there ordering one from the bartender."

Directions: Pour rum and vermouth over ice cubes, place cherry in glass; stir, then sit back and enjoy.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is the best Manhattan you'll ever have."

Directions: Dissolve the sugar in hot water in a large pitcher. Stir in the whiskey, vermouth, cherry juice and bitters. Serve in glasses over ice and garnish with a maraschino cherry.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This recipe is definitely not traditional - except in my family. It is sweet, and meant to be! You will have to do the math for single servings, this is the way I got it from my Grandfather, who always made a batch (or two) for the Holidays."

Ingredients: 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen limeade concentrate (such as Minute Maid®), thawed
1 (12 fluid ounce) can tequila (such as Cuervo® Especial)
1/2 (12 fluid ounce) can brandy-based orange liqueur (such as Grand Marnier®)
Directions: Pour the limeade concentrate into a pitcher, and fill the can with cold water. Pour into the pitcher; repeat twice more (3 cans of water). Fill the can with tequila, and pour into the pitcher; fill half the can with orange liqueur, and pour into the pitcher. Stir well, chill thoroughly, and serve over ice in salt-rimmed glasses with a lime wedge.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is the recipe that I use for all of our get-togethers that is so quick and easy and always gets rave reviews. Enjoy!"

Ingredients: 1 cup fresh peaches - peeled, pitted and sliced
Directions: Place peaches, peach nectar, ice, tequila, and triple sec in a blender. Blend until smooth.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Very yummy adult summer treat. Subtle peach flavors. I don't generally measure the ingredients when I make my margaritas because I've done it so many times. You can tweak the amounts to your own liking, but these are the things I used and they taste great."

Directions: In a cocktail mixer full of ice, combine vodka, triple sec, schnapps, orange juice, pineapple juice and sour mix. Shake vigorously and strain into glasses.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A fruity cocktail of orange juice and pineapple juice adequately spiked with vodka, triple sec and peach schnapps."

Ingredients: 1 fluid ounce hazelnut liqueur, such as Frangelico
Directions: Fill a highball glass with ice. Pour in coffee liqueur, vodka, Irish cream, hazelnut liqueur and half-and-half. Stir with a cocktail stirrer.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This tasty drink is a souped-up version of the White Russian!"

Ingredients: 1 fluid ounce orange flavored liqueur (such as Cointreau®)
Directions: Rub a lime wedge around the rims of 3 margarita glasses, and dip each glass rim into salt. Place ice cubes into each glass.
Mix together the tequila, orange liqueur, lime juice, and grapefruit juice into a pitcher, and pour into the glasses over the ice. Add 1 splash of club soda to each glass, and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A refreshing mix between a margarita and a greyhound. Not too sweet, and oh-so refreshing! Try experimenting with different grapefruit juices -- Ruby Red, fresh-squeezed, and Simply Grapefruit® all work great! "

Directions: Combine lime juice and rum in a highball glass. Add ice and club soda and stir well.
Garnish with a lime wedge.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "We don't know who Rickey was, but he sure could make a tasty drink. Simply mix rum and lime juice together and top off with some club soda."

Ingredients: 2 fluid ounces white creme de cacao
Directions: Combine Galliano, creme de cacao, cream, and ice in a blender. Puree on low speed for 10 seconds. Strain into chilled Champagne flute.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This blended cocktail combines the Italian herbal liqueur Galliano, with crème de cacao and cream for a frothy and refreshing libation."

Directions: In a cocktail shaker full of ice, combine melon liqueur, peach schnapps, coconut rum, white rum, orange juice and cranberry juice. Shake vigorously for about 60 seconds. Strain into 2 tall glasses and serve with a twist of lime zest.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is a delicious cocktail which tastes just like summer in a glass! Its also pretty lethal because it tastes so innocently alcohol free! You can make up a big bowl of it by just chucking a bottle of each spirit and a carton of each juice into a punch bowl. Adding a bottle of sparkling wine gives it some fizz -- and an extra kick!"

Ingredients: 1 1/2 fluid ounces freshly squeezed lime juice
Directions: Put ginger, sugar, and boiling water in a blender; let stand 5 minutes. Blend into a smooth syrup.
Fill a copper mug with crushed ice. Add ginger simple syrup, vodka, lime juice, and apricot. Top with club soda. Squeeze lime wedge over top and drop into mug. Stir well.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "The sour formula is the root of many cocktails, including margaritas and mules, perhaps because it's so easy to remember and so simple to adapt. All you need is: 1 part sweet, 1 part sour, and 2 parts alcohol."

Directions: Mix the rice and warm water together in a bowl, and let stand for 1/2 hour. Reserving the water, drain, and place the rice in the bowl of a food processor. Add the cinnamon and process until a paste forms. Return the rice to the water and let stand at least 2 hours, stirring occasionally as the water turns milky white.
Strain the rice through a fine sieve into a bowl or pitcher. Stir in the milk, condensed milk, vanilla, and rum, if desired, until evenly blended. Refrigerate at least 2 hours.
To serve, divide the ice cubes between four glasses, and pour the chilled horchata over the ice.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "The Mayans and Aztecs called this the drink of the gods."

Ingredients: 2 serrano chile peppers, seeded and minced
1 pickled red pepper (such as Peppadew®), minced
freshly ground black pepper to taste
Directions: Stir tomato juice, vodka, serrano chile peppers, red wine vinegar, olive brine, red pepper, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, 1 tablespoon black pepper, sriracha sauce, garlic, lemon zest, celery salt, and kosher salt together in a pitcher. Cover the pitcher and refrigerate until chilled, 2 to 4 hours.
Divide ice between 8 Collins glasses. Pour vodka mixture over ice and garnish each with celery rib, asparagus spear, green olive, and black pepper.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "I love sriracha and using it to replace the conventional Tabasco® hot sauce in my go-to Bloody Mary recipe creates an equally quenching, but slightly brighter and spicier cocktail. For more fire, substitute with habanero chiles or pepper vodka. Garnish with celery ribs, pickled asparagus, and green olives."

Ingredients: 1/2 cup half-and-half or vanilla ice cream
Directions: Fill a large glass with ice. Pour in the spiced rum, Irish cream, coffee liqueur and amaretto. Fill the rest of the glass with half and half, or vanilla ice cream.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is the best cream drink in the whole entire world. So if you like creamy drinks you will be a slave to the Jedi Mind Trick! It is radical! Please Don't Drink and Drive!"

Ingredients: 1/2 fluid ounce freshly squeezed lime juice
1 teaspoon Blue Curacao, or to taste
1/2 ounce cotton candy, or as needed (optional)
Directions: Combine rum, simple syrup, lime juice, and Blue Curacao in a cocktail shaker. Add ice, cover and shake until chilled, 10 to 15 seconds. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with cotton candy.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This cocktail is fun to shake up for a Sharknado viewing party or Shark Week. The cotton candy is worth the extra effort - it looks like a twister on top of the drink!"

Ingredients: 6 leaves fresh mint, plus more for garnish
Directions: Muddle blackberries and mint in a shaker. Add bourbon, tequila, lime juice, and agave nectar.
Fill shaker with ice. Shake and strain into two julep glasses filled with fresh ice.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "The Kentucky Derby meets Cinco de Mayo in this refreshing blackberry-mint julep margarita cocktail. Garnish each drink with a blackberry and a sprig of mint, if desired."

Ingredients: 1 cup ice cubes, or as needed
1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger berry-flavored vodka (such as New Amsterdam® Red Berry)
Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker 1/2-full with ice. Pour cranberry juice, vodka, peach schnapps, and triple sec over ice. Cover shaker and shake vigorously; strain into a martini glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is my creation, an original drink. One unique thing about this recipe, you use a shot glass. It is so delicious. Enjoy."

Ingredients: 4 fluid ounces New Age Argentinian white wine
Directions: Muddle mint leaves and lime juice together in a cocktail shaker; add ice, vodka, white wine, and club soda. Cover and shake briefly. Pour drink into a glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "The Argentinian tincho, souped up with pineapple vodka."

Ingredients: 1 cup ice cubes, or as needed
Directions: Spread sugar over a small plate. Pour lemon juice onto another small plate. Dip the rim of a martini glass in the lemon juice, then into the sugar to coat.

Fill cocktail shaker with ice. Add vodka, black cherry juice, grapefruit juice, and agave nectar. Cover shaker with lid and shake vigorously until chilled, about 10 seconds. Strain drink into prepared martini glass and garnish with maraschino cherry.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "My wife is a cherry fanatic and loves this martini. It has an excellent cherry flavor and the agave adds a unique sweetness."

Directions: Salt the rims of 2 large margarita glasses. To do so, pour salt onto a small plate, moisten the rims of the glasses on a damp towel and press them into the salt.
In a blender combine tequila, triple sec and limeade concentrate. Fill blender with ice cubes. Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses, garnish with slice of lime and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is a basic margarita recipe. You can add your favorite fresh fruits to flavor it. Fresh strawberry or mango are good choices. For a little something different, try granulated sugar rims on the glasses instead of margarita salt."

Ingredients: 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger Southern Comfort liqueur
1 (16 ounce) can Dr. Pepper ™ soft drink
Directions: Fill a tall glass with crushed ice and pour in Southern Comfort liqueur. fill with Dr. Pepper (TM) to taste.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This drink is a great social drink for anyone who dislikes a heavy alcohol taste in their drinks."

Ingredients: 1/2 fluid ounce orange-flavored liqueur (such as Cointreau®)
Directions: Rim a margarita glass with salt; place ice into glass. Pour cocktail mix, tequila, orange liqueur, brandy, and lime juice into a cocktail shaker, cover, and shake to combine. Pour into prepared glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "If you love a famous Mexican food chain's 'presidential' margarita, you'll love this recipe. The key is good tequila and brandy."

Directions: Place raspberries, strawberries, vodka, and lemonade into a blender. Cover, and puree until smooth. Pour into chilled glasses to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "My friends and I came up with this one hot day after finals during college. The surprise is in the fact there is alcohol in this drink. You can't tell just by tasting it!"

Ingredients: 1 1/2 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers hazelnut liqueur, such as Frangelico
1 1/2 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers coffee liqueur, such as Kahlua
Directions: Mix the vodka, hazelnut liqueur and coffee liqueur together in a large glass or cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake until the outside of the container is frosty, about 20 seconds. Strain into a chilled martini glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Being a bartender I am always mixing up things a bit. I especially enjoy inventing martinis. This is one of my most popular concoctions."

Ingredients: 3/4 fluid ounce coffee-flavored liqueur (such as Kahlua®)
Directions: Combine vodka and coffee liqueur in an old-fashioned glass. Add ice and stir well.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "The black Russian gets its name from the use of the quintessential Russian spirit, vodka, and the darkness the drink has from the addition of coffee liqueur."

cocktails.Recipe Name: Batida de Coco Rapida (Brazilian Coconut Cocktail)
Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups ice cubes, or as desired
7 teaspoons shredded coconut, or as desired (optional)
Directions: Combine condensed milk, vodka, ice, and coconut milk in a blender; blend until smooth. Pour cocktail into glasses and sprinkle coconut over each.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Batida (meaning 'shaken' in Portugese) is a Brazilian cocktail recipe normally made of a fruit or fruit juice and sweetened condensed milk. Use the condensed milk tin to measure the vodka and ice, as well."

Directions: Pour the chocolate liqueur, creme de menthe, vanilla vodka, regular vodka, and half-and-half cream into a cocktail shaker over ice. Cover, and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain into chilled martini glasses rimmed with chocolate syrup to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This cocktail is creamy, cool, and smooth!"

Directions: Put crushed ice in a tall glass. Pour in the vodka. Add lime juice and sugar to taste. If it is too strong, simply dilute with water.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This drink is for an acquired taste, but is VERY popular in Brazil and quite tasty if you like tart things."

Ingredients: 3 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers pina colada mix
Directions: In a blender combine spiced rum, banana liqueur, grenadine orange juice and pina colada mix. Add ice and blend to a frothy consistency.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Frothy mixed drink that will cool you off out by the beach or at any summertime activity."

Ingredients: 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger artificially sweetened citrus soda
Directions: Fill a rocks glass 1/2 full of ice. Pour in the peach schnapps followed by the citrus soda. Stir.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Alcoholic peachy drink with citrus soda."

Ingredients: 2 fluid ounces lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage
Directions: Pour the beer, soda, and grenadine syrup in a tall glass. Stir and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is a drink that you can order at any bar in France. It's a little sweet and has a pretty color; I don't like beer, but I like this drink. I use about 1/4 teaspoon grenadine, but use less or more depending on how sweet you would like your drink."

Ingredients: 1/2 cup ice cubes, or as needed
Directions: Place watermelon in a cocktail shaker and crush with a muddler; add ice cubes and vodka. Cover shaker and shake well. Strain cocktail into a martini glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Simple and delicious cocktail. Perfect for a hot summer day. You can garnish with a small piece of watermelon."

Directions: Place ice cubes into a blender, and pour in the orange juice, grapefruit juice, pineapple juice, grenadine, light rum, dark rum, and vodka. Cover, and blend until smooth. Pour into tumblers to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is a fantastic party drink your guests will love."

Directions: Muddle mint leaves, raspberries, simple syrup, and lime juice together in a shaker. Fill the shaker with ice and add vodka and rum; cover and shake until chilled. Pour entire contents of shaker into a Collins glass and top with club soda.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This fun, refreshing cocktail puts a fresh berry twist on the classic mojito. It combines silver rum and raspberry vodka with fresh berries, lime juice, and mint leaves. Top it off with a splash of club soda. A house specialty at 230 Fifth in New York City, it's the perfect summer refresher."

Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes. Pour in the whiskey, vermouth and bitters. Shake until frosty, about 15 seconds then strain into a Manhattan glass and garnish with a maraschino cherry.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "One of the great classic cocktails, this one's made the old fashioned way -- with rye whiskey."

Ingredients: 1/8 teaspoon raw sugar, or to taste (optional)
Directions: Blend cantaloupe, vodka, lime juice, and mint leaves in a blender until smooth; stir in sugar. Freeze cantaloupe mixture until slushy consistency, 45 minutes to 1 hour.
Pour blackberry brandy into a martini glass; carefully spoon cantaloupe mixture over brandy, creating a contrasting orange layer.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Cantaloupe and blackberries combine with a hint of mint and lime for a summertime flavored drink with a kick!"

Directions: Pour Benedictine into a cordial glass. Carefully pour in brandy so it floats on top of the Benedictine, creating a two-layered drink.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "The B and B cocktail gets it's simple name from it's two main ingredients--Benedictine and Brandy."

Ingredients: 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger Swiss chocolate almond liqueur
1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger white chocolate liqueur
Directions: In a tall glass over ice, pour the Swiss almond chocolate liqueur and white chocolate liqueur. Fill glass with milk; stir and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Super yummy! It can either be a tall cool drink or a blended frappe - but look out or they'll sneak up on you!"

Ingredients: 1 fluid ounce spiced rum (such as Sailor Jerry®)
1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle cream soda
Directions: Stir rum and butterscotch schnapps together in a frosted 14-ounce mug.
Pour butter flavoring into the cream soda, then turn cream soda over to pour quickly into the chilled mug. Gently drop the ice cream into the soda mixture.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "I've tried a couple of butterbeer recipes I found online, and they all were either so sweet they made me sick or they had oily butter in them that made me sick. I opted for a simplified version that tasted a little bit like less-sickly butterscotch and was strong enough to slightly inebriate something larger than a house elf. Great for Harry Potter-themed parties or Halloween. Served super-chilled in a frosted mug, it can magically warm up even the coldest wizards."

Ingredients: 1 (6 ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate, thawed and undiluted
Directions: Stir together apricot nectar, pineapple juice, water, and orange juice concentrate in a large pitcher until combined. Pour in bottle of sparkling wine just before serving.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A wonderful change from the everyday orange juice and champagne mimosa!"

Ingredients: 1/2 cup ice cubes, or as needed
Directions: Fill a glass with ice. Pour pineapple juice, mango nectar, vodka, coconut milk, and orange juice over ice; stir well.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is a super tropical drink. You can use plain or flavored vodka. For fun, use a fruit cabob as a stir stick."

Ingredients: 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger coconut flavored rum
Directions: In a mixing glass, combine coconut rum, orange juice and pineapple juice. Mix well and pour into an ice filled glass. Top with a splash of grenadine.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A delightful cocktail of orange, pineapple, coconut rum and grenadine...smooth."

Ingredients: 1 fluid ounce coffee-flavored liqueur (such as Kahlua®)
1 fluid ounce hazelnut liqueur (such as Frangelico®)
1 teaspoon heavy whipping cream, or to taste
Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice; pour in coffee-flavored liqueur, Irish cream liqueur, amaretto liqueur, hazelnut liqueur, vodka, and cream. Cover, shake, and strain cocktail into a martini glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A strong but good coffee-flavored martini!"

Ingredients: 2 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers sweet and sour mix
Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add tequila, sweet and sour mix, lime juice, sweetener, and blackberries. Put lid on shaker and shake.
Fill margarita glasses with ice. Pour cocktail into glasses.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "My husband and I had a similar drink at a restaurant one evening and decided to try to recreate it. We like our version even better."

Ingredients: 1 dash habanero pepper sauce, or to taste
Directions: In a shaker, combine all the ingredients except Squirt(R) Citrus soda and lime slices; shake well to chill. Strain drink into glass with ice; fill with Squirt soda. Garnish with lime wheel.
Enjoy responsibly!
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Satisfy your nocturnal instincts with this steamy drink of Clamato® and tequila."

Directions: Fill a 12 ounce glass with ice cubes. Pour in rum and amaretto. Fill remainder of glass with half orange juice and half pineapple juice. Add a splash of grenadine for color.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Mai Tai - a tropical and fruity rum drink."

Directions: Serve over 1 cup ice.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This cherry and vanilla-flavored cocktail is a refreshing addition to your party."

Directions: In a blender combine amaretto, milk and ice cream. Blend until smooth. Pour over ice into 4 glasses.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "The ice cream masks the liquor flavor in this delicious creamy concoction."

Directions: Fill a large tropical or Collins glass with ice cubes. In a shaker, combine the coconut rum, butterscotch schnapps, hazelnut liqueur, pina colada mix and pineapple juice. Shake vigorously, and pour over ice in the glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Although the ingredients sound like they might be a little strange together, I've received nothing but rave reviews for this quick cocktail I concocted."

Ingredients: 2 tablespoons white sugar, or to taste
Directions: Place mint leaves and 1 lime wedge into a sturdy glass. Use a muddler to crush the mint and lime to release the mint oils and lime juice. Add 2 more lime wedges and the sugar, and muddle again to release the lime juice. Do not strain the mixture. Fill the glass almost to the top with ice. Pour the rum over the ice, and fill the glass with carbonated water. Stir, taste, and add more sugar if desired. Garnish with the remaining lime wedge.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is an authentic recipe for mojito. I sized the recipe for one serving, but you can adjust it accordingly and make a pitcher full. It's a very refreshing drink for hot summer days. Be careful when drinking it, however. If you make a pitcher you might be tempted to drink the whole thing yourself, and you just might find yourself talking Spanish in no time! Tonic water can be substituted instead of the soda water but the taste is different and somewhat bitter."

Directions: Combine light rum, triple sec, lime juice, and ice in blender with 1 cup crushed ice; blend until smooth. Pour into a Champagne flute.
Garnish with maraschino cherry.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Frozen daiquiris are a great way to cool off on a hot summer day. Blend rum, sugar, triple sec, and lime juice together with ice for a frosty cocktail treat."

Ingredients: 1 fluid ounce freshly squeezed orange juice
Directions: Stick blend all ingredients until well mixed. Pour into an ice filled, 16 ounce glass. Garnish with fresh nutmeg.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "When you awake in the morning after a few too many you may very well need to have a Ramos Fizz to get you back on your feet. Henrico C. Ramos created the Ramos Fizz in 1888 at the Imperial Cabinet Saloon in New Orleans, Louisiana. This wonderful pick me up combines all the ingredients to get you up and running again. A little hair of the dog in the form of the gin, protein from the egg white, and cream to coat the stomach."

Directions: Store a cocktail glass in the freezer for 15 to 20 minutes before making the cocktail.

Pour the anise flavored liqueur into the frosted glass and turn to coat the sides. Dump excess liqueur in the sink (or drink it!). Add sugar, water and bitters to the glass, stirring to dissolve. Strain into the glass and pour in the rye. Stir and garnish with a twist of lemon.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "An oldie but a goody, this is one of the world's first cocktails, invented in New Orleans in the 19th century."

Ingredients: 8 ounces frozen sliced strawberries in syrup
Directions: Fill a blender with ice and crush. Pour in the tequila and triple sec. Add the strawberries and limeade. Blend for 30 seconds or until smooth. Serve in margarita glasses with the rims dipped in powdered sugar.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A near perfect strawberry margarita with frozen strawberries and limeade concentrate."

Directions: In the container of a blender, combine the lemonade concentrate, lemon-lime soda, rum and strawberries. Cover, and blend until smooth. Add ice and blend to desired thickness.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This refreshing drink is made with strawberries, rum and lemon-lime soda blended with ice for a great summer cool down."

Directions: In a blender full of ice, combine limeade concentrate, tequila and citrus soda. Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "The quirkiest, yet quickest frozen margarita with a taste that's hard to beat!!!"

Directions: Pour the Jagermeister, peach schnapps, and cranberry juice into a cocktail shaker over ice. Cover, and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain into shot glasses to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This shot seems to be a favorite among bar patrons. How strong you make it depends on the person drinking it."

Directions: In a rocks glass over ice, combine vodka, rum, tequila, triple sec and raspberry liqueur. top with cola to taste.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A cocktail made with vodka, rum, tequila, triple sec, raspberry liqueur and cola."

Directions: Pour the butterscotch schnapps into a small pitcher. Carefully pour in the cream soda so that you don't lose the carbonation. Stir gently and pour into goblets to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This butterbeer is a sweet cocktail that is smooth, refreshing, and just good enough to make a house-elf tipsy!"

Ingredients: 2 (12 fluid ounce) cans frozen lemonade concentrate
Directions: In a large jug or pitcher, mix together the lemonade concentrate, vodka and beer. Stir, and serve over ice.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Not really a margarita, but it looks pretty close!!"

Directions: Combine rum and lime juice in a highball glass. Top with ice and fill with cola.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This improved version of the simple rum and Coke includes fresh lime juice for added complexity. It's believed to have been invented in Cuba in the early 1900s."

Ingredients: 2 fluid ounces citrus flavored energy drink (e.g. Red Bull™)
Directions: Pour the ice into a highball glass, then pour in the vodka and Galliano. Top with energy drink and lemon-lime soda, then drizzle in honey and garnish with a straw. The honey gets thick and is fun to play with using the straw.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A delicious alcoholic drink. It's very yellow and looks good in a tall glass with a straw."

Ingredients: 1 fluid ounce amaro liqueur (such as Averno®)
1 teaspoon lemon juice, or to taste
Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice; pour in whiskey, amaro liqueur, and lemon juice. Cover shaker and shake vigorously. Strain drink into a low boy cocktail glass. Top with lemon-lime soda.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is a rich and refreshing cocktail made for lovers of whiskey. The soda water makes it a bit lighter than a straight old-fashioned."

Ingredients: 1 (32 fluid ounce) bottle pina colada drink mix
1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate
Directions: Pour pineapple juice into a large container. Add pina colada drink mix. Fill the empty bottle halfway with vodka and pour in. Stir in frozen lemonade concentrate.
Freeze, stirring every 2 hours, until pineapple juice mixture is a slushy consistency, 4 to 6 hours.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Lemonade, pineapple juice, and vodka combine in this refreshing Pina Colada Slush. Serve over 7-Up®."

Ingredients: 2 fluid ounces white creme de cacao
Directions: Chill a martini glass by filling it with 1/2 cup of ice and cold water.

Place 1 cup of ice cubes into a cocktail shaker. Pour the vanilla-flavored vodka, white creme de cacao, and Irish cream liqueur over the ice; cover and shake vigorously. Dump the ice and water from the martini glass and drizzle the inside of the glass with chocolate syrup. Strain the cocktail into the glass to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A wicked good and dangerous drink; this'll leave you seeing stars!"

Ingredients: 8 fluid ounces limeade (such as Minute Maid®)
6 fluid ounces tequila (such as Jose Cuervo 1800®)
6 fluid ounces brandy-based orange liqueur (such as Grand Marnier®)
Directions: Pour limeade into a blender. Use the limeade container to measure tequila and orange liqueur; pour into the blender. Fill the blender with ice. Blend on high until all ice is crushed and the margarita consistency is thick.
Fill the base of each margarita glass with sangria. Top with margarita mixture.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This delicious frozen margarita recipe features the sweetness of sangria mixed perfectly with top-shelf ingredients to make the ultimate margarita."

Ingredients: 2 fluid ounces sweet and sour mix
Directions: Fill a tumbler with ice cubes and pour in the melon liqueur, sour mix, vodka, and lemon-lime soda. Stir to mix.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "My daughter had a Melonade at a restaurant out of town, and came home raving about it. The menu gave the ingredients, but it took some experimenting to come up with proportions that matched the taste as she remembered it. I'm not much of a drinker, but I find this refreshing and delicious. I sometimes make mine without the vodka and think it's great as well."

Directions: In a mixing glass, combine crushed ice, vodka and applejack brandy. Stir and strain into 2 chilled cocktail glasses. Top with a splash of Calvados, garnish with a lady apple and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "I discovered this recipe on the Upper West Side at a swanky bar. This will be the new 'in' drink! A Lady apple makes a great garnish if you can find one."

Ingredients: 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger citrus-flavored soda (such as Fresca®)
Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice; add vodka, cranberry juice, and citrus-flavored soda. Squeeze lime over drink, cover shaker, and shake. Strain drink into a glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Hands down a fantastic refreshing drink!"

Directions: Shake the butterscotch schnapps, Irish liqueur, and cinnamon schnapps in a cocktail shaker with crushed ice; strain into a small glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "The bartenders at my favorite Iowa City Irish pub make this delicious shot. Be careful! One is wonderful, two is trouble!"

Ingredients: 1 fluid ounce coffee-flavored liqueur (such as Kahlua®)
Directions: Place pina colada mix, coffee-flavored liqueur, vodka, banana, and 1/2 cup of ice into a blender. Cover, and puree until smooth. Add ice a little at a time and repeat until drink reaches desired consistency.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A great refreshing summertime drink that I had in Cancun. Enjoyed it so much I got the recipe from the bartender and make it all summer long. For added flavor try blending with chocolate syrup."

Ingredients: 3/4 fluid ounce green creme de menthe
1/2 fluid ounce cola-flavored carbonated beverage (such as Coca-Cola®), or more to taste
1/2 fluid ounce lemon-lime carbonated beverage (such as 7Up®), or to taste
1/2 fluid ounce sweet and sour mix, or to taste
1 cup crushed ice, or as desired
Directions: Mix whiskey, vodka, gin, creme de menthe, cola-flavored beverage, lemon-lime flavored beverage, and sweet and sour mix together in a cocktail shake. Fill a glass with ice; pour drink over ice.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A recipe from my Grandma Briere who was a bartender for 30 years. Original price for this drink in the 70s was $1.60. Garnish with an orange slice, cherry, or any other fruit."

Directions: Fill a blender with ice; add the coconut cream, tequila, and triple sec; blend at high speed until smooth. Scatter the coconut onto a plate. Wet the rims of four glasses. Dip the glass rims in the coconut. Serve the margaritas in the prepared glasses.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Setting out to duplicate the coconut margaritas we had in Costa Rica, my first attempt was awful! I surfed the internet for a good recipe with little luck. I then took what I'd learned from my first nasty try and the ideas I picked up online and after about 5 or 6 attempts I came up with this. Enjoy!"

Directions: Fill a large glass with ice, and pour in vanilla vodka and schnapps. Pour in the lemon-lime soda, and top with a splash of grenadine.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is what my girls and I drink all the time! It can also be easily turned into a punch recipe by just remembering this: equal parts vanilla vodka and sour apple schnapps mixed with 4 parts lemon lime soda and just enough grenadine to make the mixture a nice rosy color. Sometimes we'll add a little cinnamon schnapps or Goldschlager as well, to make a 'Spiced Apple'."

Directions: Place sugar and bitters in chilled Champagne flute and fill with Champagne. Add a twist of lemon peel.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This classic drink dates back to the Civil War era and makes even a less expensive bottle of Champagne taste great with the addition of Angostura bitters and a sugar cube."

Directions: Pour the vodka into a shaker, cover, and shake well. Pour the whiskey into a well chilled martini glass, followed by the vodka. Squeeze in a dash of lemon juice. Enjoy and savor.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Best martini in the world ... James who?"

cocktails.Recipe Name: Caipirinha de Limo Tradicional (Classic Brazilian Cocktail)
Ingredients: 1 1/2 tablespoons white sugar, or to taste
Directions: Cut off the lime ends with a sharp knife; discard. Slice lime in half; remove white pith from the center. Slice into 6 wedges.
Place lime wedges skin side down into a glass; add sugar. Mash with a cocktail muddler, bruising the skin slightly. Stir in ice and cachaca.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "The traditional Brazilian caipirinha is a drink like no other! Made with cachaça and muddled lime, it's a refreshing cocktail that's easy to make."

Ingredients: 2 fluid ounces jalapeno-infused simple syrup (see footnote for recipe)
5 fluid ounces cucumber water (see footnote for recipe)
Directions: Mix vodka, jalapeno-infused simple syrup, lemon juice, and cucumber water in a cocktail shaker and pour over ice in an highball glass. Garnish cocktail with cucumber spear.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A surprisingly refreshing twist to an old classic. Jalapeno-infused simple syrup and cucumber water give a sweet and spicy kick. See footnotes for how to make cucumber water and jalapeno-infused simple syrup."

Directions: Fill mixing container with ice. Pour in vodka and Lillet blanc aperitif wine. Stir for 2 minutes, until very cold. Strain into 4 cooled martini glasses.
Cut a fresh twist of lemon peel OVER THE GLASS and drop into drink (the zest and spray of this action - falling into the glass - is crucial!)
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A clean, refreshing essence of lemon martini. Invented by Tito Class, owner of Mona's Bistro in Seattle, WA. Their best martini! Submitted by Chris Blake - bartender and friend."

Ingredients: 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger lemon-flavored rum, or to taste
1 cup lemon-lime soda (such as Sprite®), or as needed
Directions: Stir rum, lime juice, and sugar together in a glass tumbler to dissolve the sugar. Fill glass with lemon-lime soda. Garnish with lime slice.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "I wanted to create a simple drink during a Green Bay Packers game. I thought green and yellow, lemon and lime. Unbeknownst it was during the same game where B.J. Raji scored his first touchdown in the championship game between the Packers and the Bears. His last name sounded pretty cool for this. Enjoy!"

Ingredients: 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle wheat beer (Hefeweizen)
Directions: Pour cherry juice into a 16 ounce glass; pour in beer. Drink!
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This drink is remarkable! I used to order it at my favorite bar in Gelnhausen, Germany! If you don't like the taste of beer alone, you will love this drink!"

Directions: In a cocktail mixer full of ice, combine chocolate liqueur and vodka. Shake vigorously and strain into 2 chilled martini glasses. Garnish with chocolate shavings.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Chocolate HEAVEN! I used to work at a fine dining restaurant. The bartender used to create special drinks just for me since he knew I was a light drinker. He concocted this recipe and I've been hooked ever since! Chocolate Martinis ROCK!"

Ingredients: 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger sweetened lime juice
Directions: Moisten the edges of two martini glasses with a little lime juice, and then dip moistened edges into coarse salt. Place an olive in each glass.
Pour remaining lime juice into a cocktail shaker, and then add tequila, orange liqueur, sweetened lime juice, and sugar. Fill shaker with ice, shake vigorously, and strain into prepared glasses.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "These are a bit labor intensive but worth it. Fresh limes and a good lime squeezer are a must."

Directions: Fill cocktail shaker with ice. Add melon liqueur, lemon juice and simple syrup. Shake well and strain into a chilled glass filled with ice.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "We've all had sours before, but my dad's simple Melon Sour is the best I've had."

Ingredients: 2 fluid ounces 17-year old J. Wray Nephew Jamaican Rum
Directions: Fill a rocks glass with 1 cup crushed ice. Set aside in the freezer.
Combine rum, orgeat, orange Curacao, rock candy syrup, and lime juice in a cocktail shaker. Add 1 cup ice, cover and shake until chilled. Strain into the chilled rocks glass.
Garnish with half of the lime shell inside the drink and float a sprig of fresh mint on the edge of the glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "California restaurateur Trader Vic is credited with invention of the mai tai. He served the rum and juice cocktail to friends visiting from Tahiti, who exclaimed, 'Maita'i roa ae!' The term translates to 'very good' and the name mai tai stuck."

Directions: Place ice cubes into a rocks glass. Pour in vodka and cranberry juice. Stir and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "I am crazy for the fragrance and the taste of pears. When I saw pear vodka, I had to try it! I was not sure what to mix it with but finally found the perfect combination!"

Ingredients: 1/4 fluid ounce amaro liqueur (such as Hum®)
1/2 fluid ounce wormwood-flavored schnapps (such as Jeppson's® Malort®)
Directions: Combine mezcal, lime juice, simple syrup, and amaro liqueur in a cocktail shaker; fill with ice, cover, and shake until chilled. Fill a lowball glass with ice. Strain cocktail into lowball glass, top with ginger beer, and float schnapps over the top. Garnish with mint and lime.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Smoky mezcal and an unusual liqueur are the stars of this flavorful cocktail. You'll shake the mezcal with amaro, lime juice, and simple syrup, and then top it off with a splash of ginger beer and a floater of Malort® liqueur. There's so much going on in this cocktail. It's like nothing you've tasted before. Garnish with fresh mint and a wedge of lime. This exciting cocktail is the signature drink at Simone's in Chicago."

Ingredients: 1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and roughly chopped
Directions: Mix 1 tablespoon sugar with salt on a shallow, rimmed plate. Use lime wedge to wet rims of two 6- to 8-ounce glasses. Dip rims into sugar mixture.

Combine jalapeno and 1 1/2 teaspoons sugar in a cocktail shaker and muddle until sugar is dissolved and jalapeno is juiced. Add orange juice, mezcal, and lime juice to shaker, then fill with ice. Cover and shake until chilled, about 30 seconds. Strain into glasses to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Hot peppers and mezcal, a smokier version of tequila, make this the perfect summer cocktail."

Directions: Stir or shake together tequila and orange juice. Fill a chilled 12 ounce glass with ice cubes; pour in orange juice mixture. Slowly pour in the grenadine, and allow it to settle to the bottom of the glass (be patient). Garnish with a slice of orange, and a maraschino cherry.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This pretty drink with layers of orange juice and grenadine is delicious on a hot day. The fact that the ratio of juice to tequila is high makes it a good choice for a brunch cocktail."

Directions: Measure the sake, peach schnapps, orange juice and cranberry juice into a cocktail shaker. Add a generous scoop of ice. Shake until the container is frosty, about 30 seconds. Strain into a cocktail glass and serve immediately.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is a great, simple cocktail. I enjoy serving it with Asian themed dinners or appetizers."

Directions: Fill a highball glass with ice, and pour in vodka, coffee liqueur, milk, and cola; stir.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Same as a white Russian...but the touch of cola...will paralyze you!!!"

Directions: Fill a highball glass with ice, and pour in the cherry juice, vodka, and orange juice. Stir to mix, and garnish with maraschino cherries to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is a screwdriver with a twist, and quite yummy!"

Directions: Fill a highball glass with crushed ice. Pour in bourbon and rhubarb soda; stir and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Rhubarb dry soda and slightly sweet bourbon combine into a delicious cocktail that's not too sweet and not too dry. Serve over crushed ice."

Directions: Combine amaretto, gin, creme de cacao, simple syrup, and cinnamon in a cocktail shaker full of ice. Shake well; strain into 2 martini glasses.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "My friend had this at a Vancouver restaurant and begged the recipe off the bartender. It's very tasty, and not as sweet as it sounds!"

cocktails.Recipe Name: Dani's Butt Kickin' Bloody Mary Mix
Ingredients: 1 (46 fluid ounce) bottle tomato-vegetable juice cocktail
2 tablespoons hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®)
Directions: Mix vegetable juice cocktail, clam juice, Worcestershire sauce, horseradish, hot sauce, lemon juice, brown sugar, beef base, celery salt, and black pepper in a large pitcher, stirring until brown sugar and celery salt have dissolved. Allow to chill for at least 8 hours.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "When a crazy old lady hits you in the head with her purse...and she's carrying a Colt 45 in it...that's the kind of kick you want when you drink a bloody mary. I like it spicy, and I hope you do too. Add vodka and whatever garnishes you prefer. Allow to chill for at least 8 hours so that the evil inside can mature. Drink it down, enjoy the heat, and be nice to your grandma."

Directions: Fill a pitcher with ice cubes. Pour the jagermeister, coconut rum and pineapple juice over the ice. Stir and garnish with a slice of orange.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Close your eyes and imagine being in sunny California with this great drink. Perfect for chilling down with on a hot summer day. Surf's up!"

Directions: Place the strawberries, ice cubes, salt, sugar, and rum into a blender. Cover and puree until smooth.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A refreshing strawberry daiquiri."

Ingredients: pineapple and orange slices, for garnish (optional)
Directions: Stir pineapple juice, orange juice, and lime juice together in a large pitcher or punch bowl. Add pineapple, blood orange, and lime slices. Cover; refrigerate 2 to 24 hours.

To serve, pour 1/2 cup juice mixture into each glass or champagne flute. Add 1/4 cup Prosecco per serving. Slowly drizzle in 1 teaspoon Campari. Garnish with a fresh pineapple or orange slice, if desired.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "These simple, sweet mimosas are great for brunch. For a virgin version, substitute club soda or citrus-flavored sparkling water for the prosecco, and use grenadine instead of Campari."

Directions: In a cocktail mixer full of ice, combine brandy, Blue Curacao, vanilla liqueur, half-and-half and lemon juice. Shake vigorously, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a slice of lemon and a straw.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A friend of mine made me one of these one day and now this is my favorite summertime or anytime drink. Cool, creamy, and refreshing."

Directions: Pour 1/4 to 1/2 inch of sugar onto a small, shallow plate. Run one of the lime quarters around the rim of each cocktail glass, then dip the glasses into the sugar to rim; set aside.

Squeeze all of the lime quarters into a sturdy glass pitcher. Toss the juiced limes into the pitcher along with the mint, strawberries, and 1 cup of sugar. Crush the fruits together with a muddler to release the juices from the strawberries and the oil from the mint leaves. Stir in the rum and club soda until the sugar has dissolved. Pour into the sugared glasses over ice cubes to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "I had this drink at a popular chain restaurant and decided to try it at home. I have served it at a couple different gatherings now and it has always been given rave reviews. It's the perfect drink for a hot summer day!"

Directions: Combine gin and vermouth in a cocktail mixing class. Add ice and stir until chilled. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with three olives on a pick or a lemon twist.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Forget what James Bond said, a martini should always be stirred, never shaken. Traditionally made with gin and a full ounce of dry vermouth, this classic cocktail is a must-try."

Directions: Muddle sugar cube, water, and bitters in an old fashioned glass for 1 minute. Pour in whiskey and stir for an additional minute. Squeeze the lemon twist over the glass and drop it in. Add ice cubes. Garnish with a slice of orange and a maraschino cherry; serve with a swizzle stick.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "The earliest version of this cocktail was simply water, sugar, bitters, and booze. Over time, the water became ice, the booze became whiskey, and the drink became an old fashioned."

Ingredients: 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle cola-flavored carbonated beverage
Directions: Pour vodka, gin, triple sec and rum together into a large pitcher and adjust the cola proportions to your personal taste and stir. Pour into a tall glass with ice.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Be careful with this one. For the un-initiated, this drink tastes great and will creep up on you before you know it."

Directions: In a cocktail mixer, combine vodka, rum, tequila, lemon juice and cola. Stir, and pour into glass filled with ice.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "It's the same thing as a Long Island Ice Tea, except you omit the gin, and double the tequila."

Directions: Combine the brown sugar, butter, salt and hot water in 5 quart slow cooker. Add cinnamon sticks and cloves. Cover and cook on Low for 5 hours. Stir in rum.
Ladle from the slow cooker into mugs, and top with whipped cream and a dusting of nutmeg.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is the real thing - an authentic Colonial recipe except you use a slow cooker to simmer it. You will swear you are drinking a cinnamon roll, and then it hits you! Very tasty and a family favorite."

Directions: In a rocks glass with ice, combine the scotch and amaretto. Stir.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is a pre-dinner drink is also popular as a nightcap. The almond flavor of Amaretto softens the bite of the scotch. A wonderful night summer Australian drink!"

Ingredients: 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen limeade concentrate
Directions: In a blender combine limeade, beer and tequila. Fill blender to the top with ice. Blend until thick and smooth.
Salt the rims of 2 large margarita glasses. To do so, pour salt onto a small plate, moisten the rims of the glasses on a damp towel and press them into the salt.
Serve the margaritas in the salted glasses and garnish with slices of lime.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Frozen lime margaritas made with beer."

Ingredients: 1/4 cup sweetened lime juice (such as Rose's®)
1/4 cup lemon-lime soda, or to taste
Directions: Rim 2 margarita glasses with salt if desired, and fill with ice. Pour the tequila, sweetened lime juice, triple sec, and lemon-lime soda into a shaker filled with ice, hold your hand firmly over over the top of the shaker so the top doesn't pop off from the carbonated soda, and shake vigorously. Pour into prepared margarita glasses, and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A successful and upscale Mexican cantina nearby makes the best margaritas I've ever tasted. They look, smell, and taste 'purer' than any others I've had. I always assumed they were using all top-shelf ingredients, until I found out their secret. . . lemon-lime soda! Now I'm able to re-create them at home."

cocktails.Recipe Name: Top Shelf Margaritas on the Rocks
Directions: Make a simple syrup by stirring together and bringing 2/3 cup sugar and 1/3 cup water to a boil until the sugar dissolves; set aside to cool.
Make the sour mix by briskly stirring together the 2 1/4 cups water, lemon juice, 1/4 cup sugar, and egg white; set aside.
Combine the ice cubes, tequila, Cointreau, lime juice, 1 ounce of the simple syrup, and 1/2 cup of the sour mix in a pitcher; stir vigorously to infuse the ice, 8 to 15 seconds.

Run a lime wedge along the rim of an 8-ounce glass. Spread the kosher salt onto a plate and dip the glass rims in the salt to coat; add ice if desired. Strain the mixture from the cocktail shaker into the glass to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Top Shelf Margaritas sure to please the avid 'rita fanatic; as with anything, fresh ingredients are the key to a quality result, so we start with our own syrup and sour mix."

Directions: In a blender combine lime juice, sugar and rum. Blend and add ice one cube at a time until mixture is thick and smooth. Pour into 4 glasses and garnish with maraschino cherries.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "My father used to make this refreshing beverage since I can remember and...let me drink it! It is a favorite of everyone in my family and of every one who has tried it!"

Ingredients: 1 bunch mint sprigs, plus more for garnish
Directions: Juice 4 limes, yielding about 1/2 cup juice, and cut remaining lime into 6 wedges.
Grasp mint sprig stems and slap leaves against a work surface to help release their oil; transfer to a sturdy glass pitcher. Stir in lime juice, rum, and strawberry syrup. Add club soda.

Spread 1/4 to 1/2 inch sugar on a small, shallow plate. Run a lime wedge around the rim of each glass, then dip glass into sugar. Fill with ice. Pour in mojito mixture. Garnish with mint sprigs and strawberries.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Strawberry syrup adds a delicious fruity twist to the lime and mint base of this refreshing summertime favorite."

Directions: Pour the peach schnapps, watermelon schnapps, orange juice, vodka, pineapple juice, and grenadine into a cocktail shaker over ice. Cover, and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain into a chilled glass to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "I can't really take credit for this drink -- a bartender in New York created it, on a whim, based on my request for something different. So I guess you could say I inspired it. I've asked for it at many places and no one has heard of it, and I have to describe it each time, much to my dismay. It is a great drink and one that packs a punch, so be careful!"

Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Pour in the melon liqueur, Southern Comfort, Banana liqueur, vodka, orange juice and sour mix.
Shake vigorously for 1 to 2 minutes. Strain into a highball glass and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This cocktail will make your eyes squint and lay you flat! "

Directions: Fill a highball glass with ice. Pour in melon liqueur and orange juice. Stir, and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Melon liqueur and orange juice make up this beautifully bright drink served over ice."

Directions: Place strawberries, sugar, and water into blender and blend until the mixture is smooth.
Pour mixture into a 9x13-inch baking pan; stir in the wine.
Freeze, stirring once about halfway through, until mixture is slushy, 4 1/2 to 5 hours.
Remove from freezer and stir to breakup the larger frozen clumps.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A super easy grownup drink/dessert that's made with frozen rose and kind of framazing on a hot summer day. Get it in the freezer at lunch and it'll be ready in time for happy hour."

Directions: Pour whisky, orange liqueur, lemon juice, and simple syrup in a blender; add ice, cover, and blend until slushy consistency.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This frozen sidecar is great to cool off in the summer heat."

Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice; add vodka, cranberry juice, triple sec, and lime juice. Cover and shake. Strain cocktail into a martini glass. Garnish with a lime wedge and cranberries.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A festive twist on a favorite drink: the cosmo."

Directions: Measure the tequila, lime juice, sweetened lime juice and triple sec into a cocktail shaker and add a generous scoop of ice. Cover and shake until the shaker is frosty, about 30 seconds.
Rub a lime wedge around the rim of a margarita glass and dip in salt. Fill each glass with ice. Strain equal amounts of the cocktail into the glasses to serve. Garnish with a lime wedge.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is the signature drink at my in-law's home. My father-in-law developed a taste for margaritas made from scratch during the summer they spent in Zihuatanejo during the 1960s. After decades of tinkering he has arrived at this foolproof recipe for the ultimate Mexican cocktail."

Ingredients: 1 (6 ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate
3 (12 fluid ounce) cans or bottles cherry-flavored lemon-lime soda (such as Cherry 7UP®)
Directions: Mix pineapple juice, vodka, sugar, orange juice concentrate, water, and amaretto liqueur in a large container; freeze overnight. To serve, fill a large glass about half full of the slushy mixture and fill the rest of the glass with cherry-flavored lemon-lime soda.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A frozen drink that is perfect on hot summer nights."

Directions: Combine gin, applejack, lemon juice, grenadine, and egg white in a cocktail shaker. Cover and shake for 10 to 20 seconds to emulsify the egg white. Add ice; cover and shake until chilled. Strain into chilled wine glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This pink drink isn't just for ladies. A heady combination of gin and applejack are shaken together with egg white and lemon juice for a frothy drink that's given a pink hue thanks to a few drops of grenadine."

Ingredients: 1 fluid ounce bitter orange aperitif (such as Campari®)
3 dashes chocolate or mole bitters (such as Bittermens® or Fee Brothers®)
Directions: Place ice cubes into a cocktail shaker. Pour in Campari, mezcal, Amaro, and vermouth. Shake in a few dashes of bitters. Stir or shake well and strain into a cocktail glass. Drizzle with a few drops of peaty, smoky Scotch. Twist the lemon rind over the drink and drop it in.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is one of the standout cocktails served at the Barrio restaurant in Seattle. It's probably the best non-whiskey cocktail I've ever had. Choose a good quality, smoky mezcal."

Directions: Place ice cubes in a small glass. Pour in gin, pomegranate juice, and tonic water. Stir, and garnish with lime.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Try using different combos, like a Pomegranate/Mango blend."

Directions: Fill an old-fashioned glass with 1 cup crushed ice. Set aside in the freezer.
Combine light rum, gold rum, orange Curacao, orgeat, and lime juice in a cocktail shaker. Add 1 cup ice, cover and shake until chilled. Strain into the chilled old-fashioned glass. Top with dark rum.
Garnish with a wedge of pineapple and a maraschino cherry.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This variation on the classic mai tai combines three kinds of rum with orgeat, orange liqueur, and lime juice for a taste of the Pacific islands!"

Ingredients: 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger bitter orange aperitif (such as Aperol®)
Directions: Fill a wine glass with ice cubes; pour in Prosecco and carbonated water. Top cocktail with bitter orange aperitif. Garnish with orange slice.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "I discovered this gloriously refreshing drink in Berlin on a tour of Eastern European cities. Brings back wonderful memories. Serve in a wine glass. Pretty and tasty!"

Directions: In a blender combine ice, amaretto, vodka, pineapple juice and grenadine. Blend well and pour into a tall chilled glass. garnish with an umbrella, pineapple slice and cherry.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A nice drink to have around the pool on hot summer days. Garnish with umbrella, pineapple slice and cherry."

Directions: In a blender, combine rum, coffee liqueur and ice cream. Insert ice cubes until volume reaches 5 cups. Blend until smooth. Pour into chilled glasses, and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "I serve this as a summer after dinner drink or for a cool and refreshing afternoon cocktail. It's equally tasty with chocolate ice cream!"

Ingredients: 1 1/2 fluid ounces coffee-flavored liqueur (such as Kahlua®)
1 fluid ounce white creme de cacao
Directions: Combine espresso, vodka, coffee liqueur, creme de cacao, and ice in a cocktail shaker. Cover and shake until chilled. Strain into a chilled martini glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Who says you can't get a jolt of caffeine with your cocktail? Add a shot of espresso to this chocolatey drink for an added pick-me-up."

Ingredients: 1 fluid ounce Gran Gala Triple Orange Liqueur
Directions: Muddle lime juice with 1.5 tbsp. fresh cilantro
Add Blanco Tequila & Gran Gala Orange Liqueur. Stir with ice and strain into an ice filled glass. Top with Pellegrino.
Garnish with orange.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Fresh cilantro, lime juice, and an orange garnish make this Gran Gala and tequila cooler a perfect warm-weather cocktail."

Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Pour in the coconut rum, raspberry liqueur, Blue Curacao, sweet and sour mix and pineapple juice. Shake for about 15 seconds, then pour into a martini glass filled with a scoop of shaved ice. Garnish with a paper umbrella.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A grown up twist to a favorite childhood treat. This crazy snow cone is great for summer cocktail parties!"

Directions: In a blender combine pineapple juice, grapefruit juice, honey and gin. Blend until frothy. Pour into a pitcher and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A sweet recipe with a kick."

Directions: Blend tequila, triple sec, lime juice, honey, and ice in a blender until smooth.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Similar recipe to the margaritas we drank in Montreal in the old port. So delicious!"

Directions: In a cocktail mixer, combine rum, passion fruit juice and sugar. Mix until sugar is dissolved. Add the grenadine, lime juice and ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a cocktail glass. garnish with orange slice and cherry.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is a favorite of mine. I have it when I'm not in the mood for anything else"

Directions: Place the ice cubes in a cocktail shaker; pour the vodka, schnapps, cider, and ginger ale over the ice; cover. Shake until outside of shaker has frosted. Make sure to pause and slowly let the carbonated air out of the shaker once or twice during the shaking process and also when you're done before you pour. Strain into a martini glass and garnish with apple slice.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is a light, crisp, and delicious variation of an apple martini, but made in a fall style!"

Directions: In a mixing glass combine the Campari, grapefruit juice, grenadine and pineapple juice. Stir or shake to mix and pour into an ice filled glass. Top with lemonade.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "An aperitif with a sour fruit flavor! The quantities given are relative to each other, so you can make as many as you like."

Ingredients: 12 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers brandy, or to taste
12 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers rum, or to taste
1 pinch ground nutmeg, or to taste
Directions: Beat egg yolks and 2/3 of the confectioners' sugar together in a bowl until smooth; add vanilla extract, cinnamon, cloves, salt, allspice, and baking soda and beat until smooth.

Beat egg whites in a bowl using an electric mixer until frothy; add the remaining confectioners' sugar and beat until stiff peaks form. Fold egg white mixture into egg yolk mixture. Refrigerate or freeze mixture until chilled, at least 1 hour.
Spoon 2 tablespoons mixture into each mug; top each with 1 shot brandy and 1 shot rum. Fill the rest of each mug with boiling water; stir and top with nutmeg.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This was my grandfather's recipe that we pull out every year at Christmas gatherings. He served it without the cloves, cinnamon, and allspice, but we like the added spices. It'll warm you up."

Directions: Place ice in a cocktail shaker. Pour in gin, Lillet, Cointreau, and lemon juice. Spoon absinthe in a cocktail glass, and swirl to coat sides of glass. Shake cocktail, and then strain into the glass. Garnish with a Maraschino cherry.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This gin cocktail will bring you back to life, no doubt. It dates back to the 19th century."

Directions: Pour schnapps into a shot glass. Hold a teaspoon just above the schnapps, and slowly pour 151 rum onto the spoon, letting it run in a separate layer on top of schnapps.
Hold the glass away from face, and light the rum with the flame of a match or lighter. Let it burn for 15 seconds. Blow out the flame, and drink it in one gulp.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "151 rum is layered over schnapps, and lit to produce a dazzling flame. Blow the flame out before drinking!"

Ingredients: 30 (12 fluid ounce) cans or bottles Keystone Light beer
2 (12 ounce) cans frozen lemonade concentrate, thawed
Directions: In a 4 to 5 gallon sports drink dispenser, combine the light beer, vodka and lemonade concentrate. Stir gently to disperse the lemonade. Put the lid on and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This party-sized version of the classic vodka, beer and lemonade cocktail is recommended to consume before a Nebraska football game."

Directions: Place 2 large ice cubes in a rocks class. Set aside in the freezer.
Combine Scotch and Drambuie in a cocktail mixing glass. Add 1/2 cup ice and stir until chilled. Strain into the chilled rocks glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Smoky Scotch gets sweetened up with the addition of Drambuie in the classic drink called the rusty nail."

Directions: Blend the watermelon in a blender until smooth; pour into a large pitcher.
Stir the water and agave nectar together in a small bowl; add to the watermelon. Stir the tequila into the watermelon mixture. Add the blueberries and garnish with the mint to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Surprising simple and refreshing! I don't use the blender piece as my pitcher for this drink but feel free to do so if you wish."

Directions: Pour sweetened condensed milk, half-and-half, vodka, schnapps, tequila, vanilla extract, syrup, and ice into a blender. Blend until smooth. Drink as shots or on the rocks.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "I got this recipe from my mother-in-law. Tequila and strawberry flavors merge deliciously in this creamy delight."

Ingredients: 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate
1 (6 ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate
2 lemons - cut into wedges, for garnish
Directions: In a large plastic container combine lemonade concentrate, orange juice concentrate, tea, sugar, whiskey and water. Mix well and freeze for 24 hours.
Scoop into a tall glass, 3/4 full, and pour ginger ale to fill the glass. Stir and garnish with lemon wedges.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Nice for large gatherings, or just to have on hand in warm weather."

Ingredients: 1 ounce vodka (suggested flavors: citron, raspberry, mandarin)
Directions: Serve over 1 cup ice.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A hint of fruit and the lemon-lime sparkle of 7UP brighten this cocktail."

Directions: Pour the cranberry juice, vodka, schnapps, and lime juice into a cocktail shaker over ice. Cover, and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain into a chilled martini glass to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "I was making a Cosmo for myself and I didn't have any triple sec, so I used peach schnapps and loved it."

Ingredients: salt or sugar for rimming glasses (optional)
2 cups crushed ice, or as needed
Directions: Bring 1/2 cup sugar, water, and orange zest in a small saucepan to boil, stirring constantly. Simmer until sugar is dissolved, about 3 minutes. Remove simple syrup from heat and allow to cool completely.
Place watermelon in a blender or food processor. Pulse until pureed.
Stir watermelon puree into a large pitcher with simple syrup, tequila, and lime juice.

Place a small amount of salt or sugar into a saucer. Rub edge of margarita glasses with a lime wedge to moisten. Lightly dip the rim of the glass into the saucer to rim the glass; tap off excess salt or sugar.
Fill rimmed glasses with crushed ice; pour margarita mixture into glasses and garnish with lime wedges to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is the non-frozen version of my watermelon margaritas. These are so amazing and refreshing on hot summer days. To make a virgin version, omit the tequila and use a lemon-lime soda."

Directions: Pour all the ingredients into a shaker with lots of ice. Shake vigorously for several seconds and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a lime twist.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is a civil cocktail mon cherie!"

Ingredients: 3 (12 ounce) cans frozen limeade concentrate, thawed
1 drop green food coloring, or as desired (optional)
1 (2 liter) bottle lemon-lime soda (such as 7-Up®), divided
Directions: Mix limeade concentrate with vodka, green food coloring, and 1 1/2 liters of lemon-lime soda in a large plastic container with a lid. Cover the container and freeze the mixture for 1 to 3 days. Scoop the frozen slush into glasses and add a splash of the remaining lemon-lime soda to each glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Slushy alcohol drink that is very refreshing in the summer!"

Ingredients: 6 fluid ounces tomato and clam juice cocktail
Directions: Rub the rim of a cocktail glass with celery salt. Place ice in the glass, and pour in vodka and tomato and clam juice cocktail. Mix in the bouillon powder, hot pepper sauce, and Worcestershire sauce. Garnish with celery.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A fantastic drink often found north of the border. This will definitely liven up your traditional Bloody Mary."

Directions: Stir together the sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl. Rim a chilled martini glass in the cinnamon sugar mixture. Pour the vodka, schnapps, and cranberry juice into a cocktail shaker over ice. Cover, and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain into the rimmed martini glass, and garnish with a slice of apple to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This fun, festive twist on a martini has the fresh flavors of apple and cranberry. Enjoy!"

Directions: In a blender, combine coconut cream, half-and-half, pineapple juice and rum. While blending, add ice a little at a time, until mixture is thick. Pour into 4 highball glasses, and garnish with cherries.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "The real Pina Colada was invented in the Hotel Caribe Hilton in Puerto Rico during the decade of the 1950's. The inventor was a bartender who entered a world competition, and won for this drink. He did not patent the recipe for which reason I am able to make some modifications for your delight."

Ingredients: 2 fluid ounces sweet and sour mix
2 fluid ounces cream of coconut (such as Coco Lopez®)
Directions: Pour the light rum, amber rum, pineapple juice, sweet and sour mix, cream of coconut, and half-and-half cream into the pitcher of a blender with ice; blend until the cocktail has a slushy texture. Pour the slushy mixture into a glass.
Slowly and gently drizzle the dark rum over the drink so it just floats on top; serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This pina colada is like a dream in a glass-it is 25% dessert, 75% tropical vacation, and 100% adult beverage. You can hear the Pacific from Omaha if you have one of these in your hand. Enjoy! You can substitute coconut-flavored pancake syrup for the cream of coconut."

Directions: Combine the vodka, creme de cacao, banana liqueur in a shaker with ice. Shake, and strain into a martini glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A chocolate martini with a banana twist!"

cocktails.Recipe Name: Skinny Mojito with Truvia® Natural Sweetener
Ingredients: Mint leaves and lime for garnish
Directions: In a cocktail shaker add all the ingredients together except soda water and fill halfway with ice. Shake vigorously.
Double strain into glass filled with ice, add splash of soda water and garnish.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "The Cuban classic is now skinny. Truvia® natural sweetener allows you to enjoy your favorite drink again with reduced calories and no added sugar*."

Ingredients: 1/2 cup crushed ice, or as needed
2 fluid ounces peach-flavored bourbon liqueur (such as Southern Comfort ®)
2 1/2 fluid ounces sweet tea, or as needed
Directions: Muddle simple syrup and mint leaves together in a large glass; add ice. Pour in peach-flavored bourbon liqueur, peach schnapps, club soda, and sweet tea. Stir well.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A mint julep with a twist. If you don't have enough room in your glass for 2.5 ounces of sweet tea, just top it off."

Ingredients: 2 fluid ounces grapefruit-flavored soda (such as Squirt®), or more to taste
Directions: Fill a low-ball glass with ice. Pour coconut rum and peach brandy over ice. Top with grapefruit-flavored soda; squeeze lime over soda. Stir.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "I love mixing cocktails. This is a sweet refreshing cocktail that tastes like coconut lemonade. If you like stronger drinks, double the brandy."

Ingredients: 4 cups watermelon schnapps (such as watermelon Pucker®)
1 (2 liter) bottle lemon-lime soda (such as Sprite®)
Directions: Place 1 chunk of watermelon into a juicer; juice, removing as much pulp as possible. Repeat until all of the watermelon is juiced.
