Fill a glass 1/3 full with ice; pour in watermelon juice. Pour in one 1 1/2 fluid ounce shot of vodka and one 1 1/2 fluid ounce shot of watermelon schnapps; top with lemon-lime soda. Repeat for each cocktail.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A refreshing adult summer drink to share poolside or on your porch enjoying the dog days of summer! Use hurricane glassware or any kind of drinkable glass for presentation. Serve with a wedge of watermelon on the rind, like you would a lemon slice. Enjoy!"

Ingredients: 2 fluid ounces sweet and sour mix
Directions: Fill a large glass with ice; use a stir stick to mix in the light rum, amber rum, orange Curacao, pineapple juice, and sweet and sour mix.
Slowly and gently drizzle the dark rum on top of the cocktail so it floats on top of the drink.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "It's a Hawaiian vacation in a glass. You can't help but feel on vacation as you sip this tropical rum-based concoction. Be careful-this drink has a kick! You can substitute Triple Sec for the orange Curacao if you must."

Ingredients: 1/2 cup roughly chopped fresh mint leaves
8 sprigs fresh mint leaves for garnish
Directions: Combine water, sugar and chopped mint leaves in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat until the sugar is completely dissolved. Allow syrup to cool, approximately 1 hour. Pour syrup through a strainer to remove mint leaves

Fill eight cups or frozen goblets with crushed ice and pour 4 ounces of bourbon and 1/4 cup mint syrup in each. (Proportions can be adjusted depending on each person's sweet tooth). Top each cup with a mint sprig and a straw. Trim straws to just barely protrude from the top of the cups. Serve juleps on a silver platter.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Sit on the front porch in your rocking chair on a sultry afternoon and sip on one or two of these. The proper way to serve a mint julep is in a frozen silver goblet, but you can use glasses instead--just use the most elegant ones you have! You can make the syrup ahead of time and store it in the refrigerator for whenever the julep mood strikes you."

Ingredients: 1 fluid ounce sweet and sour mix
Directions: Combine the whisky, tequila, 151 proof rum, vodka, raspberry liqueur, coconut rum, triple sec, sweet and sour mix, lemon-lime soda, pineapple juice and ice in a cocktail shaker; shake. Strain into a glass filled with ice. Top with dash of grenadine syrup.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This mixed drink has many ingredients, but is the smoothest and best mixed drink you will ever try."

Directions: Pour the citron vodka, plain vodka, pear vodka, cranberry-raspberry juice, and lime juice into a cocktail shaker over ice. Cover, and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain into chilled glasses; garnish each glass with a lime wedge to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "WOW!! Yummy!!"

Ingredients: 1 fluid ounce white creme de cacao
Directions: Fill 1/2 a cocktail shaker with ice; pour in amaretto, cream of coconut, creme de cacao, and cream. Cover shaker and shake; strain into a glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Liquid Almond Joy® bar with a kick."

Directions: Pour whiskey, vodka, sweet vermouth, and ice into a cocktail shaker. Cover and shake until chilled.
Strain into a chilled martini glass and garnish with maraschino cherry and pear slice.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is one of the most popular cocktails at St. Felix Bar, in Hollywood CA."

Directions: Combine schnapps and orange juice in a highball glass. Add ice, stir to combine. Garnish with an orange slice.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "The only fuzzy about this cocktail of peach schnapps and orange juice will be your vision. Drink with caution!"

Directions: In a 1 gallon serving jar with a lid or in the 2 liter bottle from the cola, combine the cola and red wine. Put the lid on and gently rock the container to mix. Let rest for a few minutes before serving in glasses over ice.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Calimocho, or kalimotxo, is a very popular Spanish cocktail that is served in many bars and prepared by Spanish youth during traditional 'botellon' parties. Calimocho originated in the Basque region of Spain but has spread throughout the entire country and to many other parts of the world. Coca-Cola is the 'authentic' cola for preparing calimocho, but any cola will work."

Ingredients: 1 (6 ounce) package fruit flavored Jell-O® mix
Directions: In a large bowl, mix boiling water with gelatin. Stir until gelatin dissolves. Stir in vodka and cold water. Pour mixture into plastic shot glasses and chill in refrigerator for 1 hour, or until set.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "It's Jello with a kick. Vodka is mixed with any fruit flavored gelatin and drunk in a shot glass."

Ingredients: 2 fluid ounces club soda, or as needed (optional)
Directions: Fill a glass with ice.

Muddle 3 sprigs mint and sugar together in a cocktail shaker; add ice, rum, lime juice, and guava nectar. Cover and shake 10 times. Strain drink into glass filled with ice; add club soda and garnish with 1 mint sprig.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Fresh, bright fruit and mint notes make this a sweet hit on hot days and warm evenings."

Directions: Combine the limeade, tequila, triple sec, sugar, salt, and vanilla extract in a blender; fill with ice. Blend until smooth.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "My family jokingly calls these 'Catholic Margaritas' because my Catholic relatives make these better than anyone else we know. Despite the powdered sugar these are not too sweet."

Ingredients: 3 fluid ounces freshly squeezed tangerine juice
Directions: Place ice in a martini shaker and pour tangerine juice, vodka, and orange liqueur over ice. Cover, shake vigorously, and pour into a martini glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is an adult crowd pleaser and my answer to what to do with all the tangerines on my tree. It is refreshing and oh, so good!"

Ingredients: 1 fluid ounce orange-flavored liqueur (such as Cointreau®)
1 fluid ounce raspberry-flavored liqueur (such as Chambord®)
Directions: Pour vodka, orange-flavored liqueur, raspberry-flavored liqueur, acai-pomegranate juice, and lime juice over ice cubes in a cocktail shaker; cover and shake until well-chilled. Strain into a martini glass and garnish with 3 grapes.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is a delicious twist to your traditional cosmo. It is sure to be a hit at your next dinner party. Three grapes on a swizzle stick makes a nice garnish."

Directions: In a blender combine rum, daiquiri mix, and a good dash of Blue Curacao, add as much ice as desired and process until all ice is chopped. Drinks should be thick and a putrid, toxic-waste green but very fruity and delicious. Serve generously in tall glasses and enjoy!
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This drink was invented with Ms. Sarah Johnson over games of Phantasmagoria 2 and bowls of Cajun popcorn. To fully enjoy this drink, make sure you drink it at least once while viewing the Troma movie of the same name."

Ingredients: 3 fluid ounces sweet and sour mix
Directions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine vodka and sweet and sour. Shake well, then strain into a tall glass full of ice. Fill the glass with carbonated water. Cut orange slice into quarters.
On a cocktail sword, spear cherry first, then spear orange slice through the peel. Hang sword from the rim of the glass, so that fruit is in the drink.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Here's a GREAT and refreshing drink for parties!"

Directions: Combine gin and grapefruit juice in a highball glass. Add ice and stir well.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "The refreshing mixture of grapefruit juice and vodka makes the greyhound an ideal choice for a summertime refresher."

Ingredients: 5 strips bacon, or more to taste
1 (46 fluid ounce) bottle tomato-vegetable juice cocktail (such as V8®)
1 tablespoon hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®)
1/4 cup Irish stout beer (such as Guinness®) (optional)
Directions: Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon slices on paper towels. Cut into small pieces.

Pour 1/2 of the tomato-vegetable juice into a large pitcher. Add cooked bacon, Worcestershire sauce, lime juice, horseradish, pickle juice, green olive juice, hot sauce, celery salt, and cayenne pepper. Stir vigorously. Add remaining tomato-vegetable juice and stir again. Add vodka and stout beer; stir. Pour into ice-filled glasses.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A great Bloody Mary drink that tastes like a meal! Includes pickles, olives, and even bacon! With a hint of Guinness® to give it that something extra you'll want to serve it to your friends over and over! Garnish with celery stalks, pickles, or olives."

Ingredients: 1/4 cup club soda, or as needed
Directions: Fill a chilled cocktail glass with ice; add whiskey and lemon juice. Stir in sugar until dissolved. Top off with club soda. Garnish with lemon slice.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Of the Collins siblings, John's gin-toting brother, Tom, is more famous. With whiskey, John is somewhat similar to a whiskey sour with club soda."

Directions: Place ice into a shaker, and pour the vermouth and bourbon over the ice. Mix well. Pour drink into a cocktail glass, and garnish with a cherry.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This drink is made with bourbon and vermouth, but it's not a Manhattan without the cherry."

Directions: Pour ice into a cocktail shaker; pour dill pickle juice and vodka over the ice. Cover the shaker and shake vigorously for about 20 seconds; strain into martini glasses. Garnish each cocktail with a dill pickle spear.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Surprisingly good!"

Ingredients: 1/2 (10.5 ounce) can condensed beef consomme (such as Campbell's ®)
1 tablespoon hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®)
Directions: Mix the tomato juice, beef consomme, Worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, hot pepper sauce, celery salt, and black pepper together in a pitcher; chill.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "My father-in-law first introduced me to this homemade bloody mary mix. It is very similar to what you'd buy in a store. Made as is, it is very spicy. You can customize it to your taste by cutting back on the pepper and hot sauce; I like about half the pepper and hot sauce. Enjoy this wonderful mix! It is so easy and much cheaper than buying pre-made mix."

cocktails.Recipe Name: Next Best Thing to Lulu's Pina Colada
Ingredients: 1 (10 ounce) can frozen pina colada mix
1 cup crushed pineapple in juice, undrained
Directions: Combine the pina colada mix, pineapple with juice, vanilla ice cream, rum, and ice in a blender. Blend until slushy.
Pour the whipping cream into a bowl, and beat until soft peaks form. Stir into the pina colada mixture to blend evenly; pour into four glasses. Top each drink with a cherry.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Jimmy Buffett's sister, Lulu, owns a very popular restaurant in Gulf Shores, Alabama. Lulu's serves the ABSOLUTE best Pina Colada in the world there! Here is the next best thing to one of hers! If you can't find the frozen mixer, 1/2 can coconut cream and enough pineapple juice to create a simulated 'can's worth' will work."

Directions: Fill a hurricane glass with ice. Pour in the rum, coconut rum, vodka, gin, triple sec, orange juice, pineapple juice, and grenadine. Stir well with a bar spoon, then pour the 151 rum over the back of the spoon to float the liquor on top of the drink. Garnish the glass with orange, lime, and a cherry.
Sip with a straw from the bottom for a 'sneak up on you' punch or sip from the top for a 'knock you down' twister.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This beverage is known for its 'sneak up and blow you away' power. There are many different versions, but I believe you will find mine a very good blend of rums, other alcoholic beverages and fruit juices. If you can walk after two of these...well...you just think you can. Everything is bigger and better in Texas -- just try this and see."

Ingredients: 2 fluid ounces chilled lemon-lime soda per serving
Directions: In a blender, combine . Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve.
In a cocktail mixer, combine whiskey, triple sec, lemonade and lemon-lime soda. Shake until mixed, then pour into a Collins glass filled with ice. Garnish with lemon wedge.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A lemonade drink suitable for anytime of the year. Refreshing, yet intoxicating. A tasty treat!!"

Ingredients: 2 cups ice cubes, or as needed
2 fluid ounces Irish whiskey (such as Jameson®)
3/4 cup ginger ale, or as needed
Directions: Pour ice cubes into a pint glass. Add Irish whiskey; top glass off with ginger ale. Pour lime juice into glass and garnish cocktail with lime wedge.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Timothy O'Toole's bar in Chicago, IL, a place with an undying loyalty to the Bears, features this big Irish whiskey-infused drink flavored with ginger ale and lime. The cocktail is named after Jameson® whiskey, aka 'Big Jamo.' 'There's a big pour, a solid 8-count of Jamo in there,' the bartender told us."

Ingredients: 1 habanero pepper, seeded and diced - or more to taste (wear gloves)
Directions: Place habanero pepper, tomato juice, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, onion powder, cumin, and salt in a blender. Blend until smooth. Adjust level of spice by adding more habanero pepper, if desired. Refrigerate until chilled, at least 2 hours.
Fill 2 old fashioned glasses with ice, pour 2 ounces of vodka in each glass, and top off with bloody mary mix.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "I had an larger-than-expected harvest from my habanero plant and came up with this idea for a bloody mary with a kick. Also pretty good without the vodka as a morning start-me-up drink. The longer it sets, the hotter it gets. I have yet to have a batch make it past the 2nd day."

Directions: Combine 2 tablespoons Prosecco, blackberry juice, and sage leaves in a glass; mash with a cocktail muddler. Pour in remaining Prosecco; stir gently.
Strain cocktail into a chilled stem glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Who says that Prosecco cocktails are only for tropical climates? Try this twist on a Prosecco bellini during the holidays - or anytime, we won't tell! Garnish with fresh blackberries and a sage leaf."

Directions: Puree raspberries and mint leaves in a blender until smooth. Strain into a serving pitcher. Puree the cubed watermelon until smooth, and strain the juice into the serving pitcher. Stir in the margarita mix, coconut rum, and ice cubes. Garnish each glass with mint sprigs.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "I made this up after looking for an appetizing way to rid myself of an extra watermelon. Lovely to drink on a hot day!"

Ingredients: 1 tablespoon white sugar, or to taste
Directions: In a small cup, dissolve the sugar in the lemon juice. Pour the lemon juice and sugar and Pisco into a cocktail shaker. Add ice, cover and shake until the outside is frosty, about 30 seconds. Strain into a cocktail glass and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Pisco Sour is a popular drink in Chile and Peru made with Pisco and lemon juice."

Ingredients: 1 fluid ounce vodka (such as Grey Goose®)
1 fluid ounce creme de cacao liqueur
1/2 cup club soda, or as needed
Directions: Fill a cocktail glass with ice cubes. Pour in vodka and creme de cacao; top with club soda.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is a delicious drink I invented one night. Careful though, because they sneak up on you!"

Directions: Pour margarita mix, sake, and cranberry juice into a cocktail shaker. Shake until well-combined; pour into a martini glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Fresh and easy to drink!"

Directions: In a blender, combine ice, sugar and strawberries. Pour in lime juice, lemon juice, rum and lemon-lime soda. Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A frosty blender full of strawberry-citrus slush. You will enjoy this with or without the rum!"

Ingredients: 3 fluid ounces lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage
Directions: In a tall glass over ice, combine rum, lemon-lime soda and cranberry juice. Garnish with a slice of lime.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Fruity and full of flavor. The best way to get the party rollin'!"

Ingredients: 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger coffee flavored liqueur
1/2 banana, peeled and sliced lengthwise into quarters
Directions: Drizzle chocolate syrup round the inside of a martini glass.
Combine banana liqueur, coffee liqueur, milk, and ice in a shaker. Shake vigorously, and strain into martini glass. Garnish with banana spears.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "One of my favorite restaurants gave me the ingredients to this drink. Play around with the ingredients and adjust to your liking. This is so good, it tastes like a milkshake!"

Directions: In a large pot, combine the apple juice, ginger ale and brown sugar. Bring to a simmer and cook for 20 minutes. Cool to room temperature. Stir in the whiskey and spiced rum and let stand for 1 hour. Pour into 1 gallon jugs or containers and place a cinnamon stick in each one. Cover and store until serving. This can be served warm, but don't heat too much or the alcohol will burn off.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A wintertime beverage that tastes just like apple pie! It can be served warm or cold."

Directions: Combine the limeade, tequila, grapefruit juice, and ice in a blender; blend until smooth. Serve in glasses garnished with lime wedges.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A mixture of lime and grapefruit make a refreshing margarita. My friends love this one!"

Directions: Muddle (crush) together the mint leaves, lime wedges and sour apple schnapps in a glass using the handle of a wooden spoon. Add lemon rum and pineapple juice; shake well and pour over ice. Top with club soda.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This mojito is not too sweet, but is very flavorful."

Ingredients: 1/4 cup ice cubes, or as needed
Directions: Combine rum, passion fruit juice, mango juice, lime juice, grenadine, and nutmeg in a cocktail shaker; cover and shake. Fill a glass with ice; pour cocktail over ice.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is my go-to cocktail recipe, ready in just a few minutes! Feel free to experiment with the flavors. You can use vodka or coconut rum or you can add peach schnapps; it is entirely up to your tastes."

Directions: Add all ingredients in an ice filled shaker. Shake until well mixed and chilled and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with two fresh raspberries on a bamboo pick.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is the signature drink in the Tabu Ultra Lounge. It is a variation of a classic cocktail called a Strawberry Fizz that was traditionally served in a 6-8 ounce glass filled with fine ice and topped with charged water. The Tabu Cocktail is a great introduction to gin for the non-gin drinker and a must for those that enjoy a gin based cocktail."

Ingredients: 1 fluid ounce Irish cream liqueur (such as Bailey's®)
1 fluid ounce creme de menthe liqueur
Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice; add vodka, Irish cream liqueur, and creme de menthe. Put lid on shaker, shake to chill liquid, and strain into a shot glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This delightful shooter will have you begging for more. With a flavor that is just like the thin mint cookies, what could go wrong!"

Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice; pour vodka, rum, and blue Curacao over the ice and stir. Pour lemon-lime soda into the shaker; stir gently. Strain beverage into a cocktail glass and garnish with lemon wedge.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is a perfect drink for summer or anytime of year as it makes a wonderful presentation because of its color. Make a big batch of them for all your friends. It's quite easy to make, too!"

Directions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle raspberries and thyme. Add gin, egg white, simple syrup, and lemon juice. Shake until mixture no longer sounds sloshy and you feel a lot of pressure. Add ice to fill shaker half-full. Shake again until very cold. Strain into a coupe or cocktail glass. Dust top with cinnamon, or garnish with lemon zest curl or additional thyme.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "The egg white foam on top of this pretty drink begins to break down after about 10 minutes, so be sure to take a photo of your Clover Club and drink it up before that happens."

Directions: Stir tomato juice, lime juice, pickled jalapeno pepper juice, vinegar, white sugar, Worcestershire sauce, horseradish, salt, pepper, cloves, onion powder, and garlic powder in a 2-quart pitcher.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Mother-in-law gave me this recipe. It tastes better then the name brand store stuff. Spice it up or down to your tastes. Chill and mix with desired amount of vodka and ice."

Directions: In a cocktail mixer full of ice, combine amaretto, Southern Comfort and sweetened lime juice. Shake vigorously and strain into glasses.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Equal parts amaretto, Southern Comfort, and top of with as much lime cordial as you feel necessary. Watch out, this one packs a punch."

Ingredients: 2 fluid ounces silver tequila (such as Patron®)
1/4 cup club soda, or as needed
Directions: Combine tequila, mint leaves, sugar, and lime wedges in a tall glass; vigorously stir the mixture, crushing mint with the back of a spoon to release oils and squeezing juice from the lemon wedges. Top with club soda and stir gently to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A yummy twist on the classic mojito."

Directions: Combine amaretto and lemon juice in a cocktail shaker. Add ice and shake until chilled. Strain into chilled sour glass.
Garnish with a slice of orange.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "The easy to make drink is hard to put down. A little sweet and a little tart, the amaretto sour is a simply delicious cocktail."

Directions: Measure rum and coffee liqueur into a coffee mug. Pour in hot coffee. Top with Irish cream, and garnish with a cherry.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A wonderful coffee treat with a kick. If you live in Newfoundland, you can use Screech instead of rum. Add a dollop of whipped cream if you like."

Ingredients: 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger sour apple schnapps
Directions: Fill a drink shaker with ice, and pour in the sour apple schnapps, whiskey, and cranberry juice. Shake well, then strain into a martini glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "My favorite local bar shared this recipe with me. Tastes just like a Washington red apple!"

Directions: Fill a tall glass with ice. Pour in melon liqueur and amaretto liqueur. Top with cranberry juice.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is a wonderful drink that can be made in large quantities. People that don't like the taste of alcohol will love this one. If making in a punch bowl, throw in pieces of tangerines and other fruits as garnish."

Ingredients: 1 (6 ounce) can frozen pink lemonade concentrate, thawed
2 (2 liter) bottles lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage
Directions: Dissolve the sugar in the water in a gallon-sized, freezer-safe container. Stir in the grenadine, cherry juice, lemon juice, cherry brandy, gin, pineapple juice, and lemonade concentrate. Freeze for 24 hours, stirring at least twice during this time.
To serve, place 1/4 cup of the slush in a a glass, and top with lemon-lime soda. Garnish with a cherry to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is a Christmas or hot summer day favorite alcoholic beverage. A must try."

Ingredients: 5 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers creme de cacao liqueur
Directions: In a cocktail mixer full of ice, combine vodka, creme de cacao and chocolate syrup. Shake vigorously and strain into 4 cocktail glasses.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "For those who like a little candy in their drinks - creme de cacao and chocolate syrup are shaken with vodka and ice."

Directions: Fill a shaker with ice and pour in vodka, vermouth and cranberry juice. Shake vigorously for 10 seconds. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lime
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is a great drink for folks who like the presentation of a martini, but can't stomach the strong alcohol taste. The cranberry juice takes the bite right out of this drink and gives it a smooth taste."

Directions: Place ice, milk, instant hot chocolate mix, cherry brandy, and vanilla extract in a blender. Blend until smooth, about 2 minutes.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is like eating Black Forest cake in a glass! Serve garnished with maraschino cherries if desired or with some whipped cream and grated chocolate."

cocktails.Recipe Name: Quick and Easy Chocolate Mint Eggnog
Ingredients: 1 cup peppermint mocha-flavored coffee liqueur (such as Kahlua®)
Directions: Stir eggnog, chocolate syrup, coffee liqueur, and peppermint extract together in a large bowl with a whisk until smooth. Fold whipped topping through the eggnog mixture.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Quick and easy eggnog. Perfect for holiday parties and for gifts! You may garnish with whipped cream and crushed peppermint candy."

Ingredients: 2 (6 ounce) cans frozen peach juice concentrate
Directions: In a blender combine ice, peach schnapps, peach juice concentrate and vanilla. Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A drink that is smooth and sweet, and yet can also pack a punch!"

Directions: Chill cocktail shaker and glass (champagne flute or collins glass) in the freezer. Add ice to shaker. Pour gin, simple syrup, and lemon juice into shaker. Shake well. Fill chilled glass half full of ice, then strain cocktail into the glass. Top with champagne and garnish with a lemon slice.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A classic, hard-hitting refresher with Champagne and gin."

Directions: Combine the limeade, tequila, and triple sec in a blender; fill with ice; blend until smooth.
Wet the rims of six glasses and dip in kosher salt. Pour mixture into glasses to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "These are close enough to margaritas for a working-through-college budget."

Directions: Pour the rum, amaretto, lime juice, pineapple juice, and cranberry juice into a tall glass with ice; stir.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This drink originated in Fredericton, New Brunswick, Canada. There are several different variations. I added the lime juice myself for the extra zing. Very fruity to cover the taste of alcohol. The primary flavours are coconut and pineapple. Garnish with a cherry, some orange peel, or a lime wedge."

Ingredients: 36 leaves fresh mint, or to taste
Directions: Muddle sugar and mint leaves together in pitcher until leaves are well broken down. Add limes and muddle until limes are juiced. Stir rum into sugar mixture; add club soda and stir until sugar is dissolved.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "I have served this to people who have sworn that they dislike mojitos and they love it. I believe it is the fresh ingredients and the use of sugar, instead of simple syrup, muddled together that makes this cocktail refreshing and delicious. It takes a little bit of work but the results are well worth it. Serve over ice."

Directions: Place one maraschino cherry into each of 4 shot glasses or cordial glasses. Combine the vodka, lemon juice and triple sec in a chilled cocktail shaker. Shake then pour over maraschino cherries in the glasses.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "These drinks are refreshing and palate cleansing with a tangy citrus flavor. They are also quite an attractive cocktail."

Directions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, shake the Southern Comfort liqueur, pineapple juice, and raspberry wine until well blended. Strain into a martini glass, and garnish with a slice of fruit.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Cool cocktail with raspberry and pineapple flavors."

Directions: Pour the rum, lime juice, sugar and ice into the container of a blender. Blend for 10 seconds, or until ice is fine. Pour into two daiquiri glasses.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "The basic drink that everyone loves - the daiquiri. Fancy enough for company, good tasting enough for any day of the week."

Ingredients: 1 (8.3 ounce) can citrus flavored energy drink (e.g. Red Bull™)
Directions: Pour the champagne and energy drink into a large pitcher. Stir to mix, pour into glasses, and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "I was tired of champagne and orange juice so I tried this last 4th of July and loved it!"

Ingredients: 1 teaspoon white sugar, or to taste
Directions: Blend strawberries, tequila, lime juice, triple sec, and 1 teaspoon sugar in blender to combine, about 10 seconds. Add ice cubes; blend on high until the ice is crushed, about 15 seconds.
Rub lime wedge around the rim of a glass. Spread 1 teaspoon sugar onto a plate. Dip glass rim in sugar to coat. Pour margarita into the glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A refreshing variation on a classic frozen margarita."

Ingredients: 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger triple sec liqueur
2 fluid ounces lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage
Directions: Fill a tall glass with ice. Pour in the gin, triple sec, peach schnapps and orange juice. Fill the glass with lemon-lime soda and finish with a dash of grenadine. Stir and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Very fresh and tasty alcoholic drink with an peachy-orange twist! Watch out and be sure to sip slowly - not for the faint-hearted!!!"

Directions: Place 2 lemon wedges, 4 Thai basil leaves, and sugar in a cocktail shaker and mash well with a cocktail muddler. Pour in vodka and ice cubes; cover and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted, about 45 seconds. Strain into 2 chilled martini glasses and garnish each with 1 lemon wedge and 1 Thai basil leaf.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Martini made with Thai basil. Add a sugar rim if you like."

Directions: In a blender, combine ice, rum, limeade concentrate and carbonated water. Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A simple Daiquiri recipe. You may omit rum to make a virgin equivalent, or change to another fruit concentrate."

Ingredients: 2 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers Southern Comfort liqueur
Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Pour in the Southern Comfort, vermouth and aromatic bitters. Shake for about 15 seconds then strain into a highball glass with or without ice. Garnish with a maraschino cherry.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Once you try these you may need to go back to a cheaper whiskey!! Extremely tasty and addicting! I make them shaken. 'Up' on a cool day before dinner, or with ice on a hot day anytime. Good quality ingredients are the key to making this drink unforgettable. However, very well worth it, (if you're over the age of 45 and a Manhattan lover)."

Directions: Place the crushed ice in a large pitcher and pour in the gin, dark rum, 151 proof rum, light rum, vodka, grenadine, orange juice, pineapple juice, and lemon juice. Stir well to mix, then pour into a large, decorative cocktail glass and garnish with pineapple, cherries, and straws.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Routinely found at Chinese restaurants, this punch-like cocktail is absolutely mouthwatering. This goes great with Chinese and Polynesian food."

Ingredients: 3 dashes hot pepper sauce (e.g. Texas Pete's™)
1 cup tomato and clam juice cocktail
Directions: Fill a large tumbler with ice cubes. Pour in the vodka, then drop in the olives and the olive brine. Season with celery salt, pepper, Worcestershire sauce and hot pepper sauce. Fill the remainder of the glass with tomato and clam juice cocktail. Stir with the celery stalk and leave it in as a garnish. Sprinkle with a little bit of celery salt before serving.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is my Wisconsin version of a classic Bloody Mary drink. On special occasions, garnish with skewered bite-size pieces of Wisconsin Cheddar, Monterey Jack, pepperoni, salami, green olives or cocktail shrimp on top. Best when consumed before noon."

Directions: Combine strawberries and sugar in blender; blend until smooth. Pour in pineapple juice, lime juice, and rum. Pulse until combined. Serve over ice.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Fresh strawberries paired with pineapple and lime make for a perfect drink on that first hot day of summer! Dark spiced rum adds a special flavor that stands up to the flavor burst you get from the fresh berries."

Ingredients: 2 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers coconut flavored rum
1 fresh pineapple spear or ring for garnish
Directions: Measure the vodka, coconut rum and banana liqueur into a cocktail shaker and add a scoop of ice cubes. Cover and shake until the outside is frosty, about 30 seconds. Strain into a martini glass and garnish with a fresh pineapple spear or pineapple ring.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Just imagine sitting on the beach in Maui while you're sipping this pretty cocktail."

Directions: Place the ice into a blender pitcher. Pour in the tequila, triple sec, and orange juice. Add the strawberries, blueberries, raspberries, and sugar. Cover, and blend until the mixture is smooth, or to your desired consistency. Pour into chilled glasses to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This frozen margarita is a berrilicious treat. Sweet, cool and goes down smooth. Great for unwinding on a hot day or any festive occasion."

Ingredients: 3 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers pumpkin flavored liqueur
Directions: In a cocktail mixer full of ice, combine pumpkin liqueur, spiced rum and half-and-half. Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled martini glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This festive Autumn martini is like pumpkin pie in a glass. Try coating the rim of the glass with cinnamon sugar or sprinkle nutmeg on top as a garnish before serving."

Directions: In a blender combine tequila, triple sec, mango, water and ice. Blend until smooth.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This delicious fresh mango margarita is very refreshing. For an extra special twist, pour a thin layer of Grand Marnier over the top of the margarita."

Directions: In a cocktail mixer full of ice, combine vodka, triple sec, lime juice and cranberry juice. Shake vigorously and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lime.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "The best Cosmopolitan I've ever had!"

Ingredients: 2 1/2 fluid ounces sweet and sour mix
Directions: Pour vodka, triple sec, sour mix, and orange juice over ice into a cocktail shaker. Affix the lid, and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain into a highball glass filled with crushed ice, and garnish with a slice of orange.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "I just made this up one day with the ingredients I had. With the martini craze, I decided to call it an orange martini, but it is just a good tropical drink for a summer day."

Directions: In a cocktail mixer, combine sloe gin, Southern Comfort, triple sec, Galliano and orange juice. Shake vigorously and strain into 2 glasses with ice.
Garnish each with a cherry and 1/2 slice of orange.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This drink is made with sloe gin, Southern Comfort, triple sec, Galliano and orange juice. "

Ingredients: 1 cup ice, or more if desired
Directions: Blend sour mix, pineapple juice, tequila, Blue Curacao, lime juice, and ice together in a blender until smooth.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Amazing summer drink. Beautiful and delicious."

Ingredients: 1 (12 ounce) can chilled diet lemon-lime soda
Directions: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes. Pour in the whiskey and top off with lemon-lime soda. Stir gently and serve immediately.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "I like this so much, I had to let others know about it. I hope you enjoy it too."

Ingredients: 3/4 cup chilled Champagne or sparkling wine
Directions: Pour ice-cold sparkling wine into a champagne flute. Slowly add pear cider so it does not fizz over. Serve chilled and immediately.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Ran out of orange juice one morning and was too hot and tired to squeeze more ... and voila! It also tastes lighter than the orange juice version and doesn't diminish that lovely champagne fizz. Perfect for the south, where its 85 degrees at 10 am for brunch out on the porch!"

Ingredients: 4 ripe unpeeled peaches, pitted and coarsely chopped
3 sprigs basil, tied together with string
3 dashes aromatic bitters (such as 18.21 Prohibition Aromatic Bitters)
2 fluid ounces lime-flavored sparkling water (such as La Croix®)
Directions: Combine chopped peaches, sugar, water, and 3 sprigs basil in a small pot over medium heat. Simmer, stirring occasionally, until sugar dissolves, about 5 minutes. Cool syrup to room temperature, about 10 minutes. Discard basil sprigs.
Pour syrup into a Mason jar, seal, and refrigerate until completely chilled, about 1 hour.

Measure 3 fluid ounces of syrup and peaches into a cocktail shaker; muddle to break peaches up. Add 4 ice cubes, bourbon, and bitters; cover and shake vigorously until ice is mostly melted. Pour into a chilled 8-ounce glass; add remaining 4 ice cubes. Gently stir in sparkling water. Garnish with a peach slice and basil leaf.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A juicy way to wind down after a busy day, and a good way to use up ripe peaches. Made and named for my friend Deb on her birthday. The peach-basil syrup makes 2 1/2 cups, enough for 8 to 10 cocktails. It keeps in the fridge for up to 3 weeks."

Directions: Pour the Chambord, Frangelico and vodka into a cocktail shaker over ice. Cover, and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain into a chilled martini glass, and garnish with chocolate shavings to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Three flavors in one delicious drink!"

Directions: Place the cherry into a chilled martini glass. Pour in the vodka, then the pineapple juice. Slowly pour in the grenadine. It should sink to the bottom with the cherry.
Mix together before drinking.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is a perfect girl drink. Pink and sweet."

Directions: Pour schnapps into a small fluted glass. Put a teaspoon just above the schnapps, and slowly pour Southern Comfort onto the spoon, letting it run in a separate layer on top of schnapps. Do not mix, it must be layered.
Hold the glass away from face, and light the Southern Comfort with the flame of a match or lighter. Let it burn for 15 seconds. Blow it out and down it.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Southern Comfort is poured in a layer over peppermint schnapps. It is then lit, producing a blue flame. Don't forget to blow it out before drinking!"

Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Pour in whiskey, vermouth, and anisette. Stir well; strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with twist of lemon.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A Manhattan at heart, but with anisette instead of bitters."

Directions: Place ice in a cocktail shaker. Pour in rye whiskey and dry vermouth. Add aromatic bitters and maraschino liqueur. Shake and strain into a chilled martini glass; garnish with lemon twist.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is a rye whiskey cocktail similar to its brother, the Manhattan, but this one has dry vermouth, optional Amer Picon, and a splash of maraschino liqueur. You can find Amer Picon online; if you like, use that in place of the bitters."

Ingredients: 1/4 fluid ounce creme de menthe liqueur
Directions: Fill a shot glass half-full with Irish cream. Pour in chocolate liqueur to three-fourths full. Top with creme de menthe.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A shot that tastes like a chocolate mint cookie with a bite."

Ingredients: 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger coffee flavored liqueur
1/2 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger Irish cream liqueur
1/2 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger creme de menthe
Directions: Fill an 8 ounce tumbler with ice. Pour in the vodka, coffee flavored liqueur, Irish cream, and half-and-half; stir. Drizzle creme de menthe on top to garnish.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is an alcoholic drink for the White Russian lover. The twist is the addition of creme de menthe which not only give it a nice green color but makes the whole drink taste like a mint cookie!"

Ingredients: 2 fluid ounces single malt Scotch whiskey
1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger creme de cacao liqueur
Directions: Pour Scotch over ice in a chilled old fashioned or collins glass. Fill glass with milk, and slowly pour creme de cacao over milk. Garnish with 2 maraschino cherries.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Single malt Scotch is smoothed out with creme de cacao and milk, and two cherries are popped upon the top."

Directions: Fill a highball glass with ice, pour in pisco, then fill with cola. Garnish with a slice of lime.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Here's the Chilean version of rum and cola, made with pisco, the national liquor. Call it a 'Chile Libre'!"

Directions: In a mixing glass, combine lemon juice, vodka and sugar. Stir until dissolved, then pour into glasses filled with ice. Garnish with a lemon slice and sprig of mint.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Fresh squeezed lemon juice with vodka. It just doesn't get better than that."

Directions: In a large glass over ice, pour 1/2 can of tomato-vegetable juice cocktail. Stir in the vodka.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "An easy version of the tomato-vodka cocktail - a classic."

Ingredients: 2 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers premium tequila blanco
Directions: Blend the tangerine juice, ice, tequila, and agave nectar in a blender until the ice is thoroughly crushed. Dispense into 2 margarita glasses to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "An old friend of mine, famous tequila maker, made this margarita for me. I like it because the fresh juice makes me feel healthy, while the tequila makes my spirit feel better. The agave honey is a delicious alternative to sugar, which makes this margarita even better!"

Directions: Combine the tequila, triple sec, fresh lime juice, sweetened lime juice, and ice in a large pitcher; stir.
Pour the kosher salt onto a plate. Rub the rim of a glass with a lime wedge. Dip the rim of the glass into the salt; fill glass with margarita mixture; repeat for each serving.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "After tweaking with several other margarita recipes, I finally found a way to get that 'real' margarita taste in a pitcher size for parties."

Directions: In the container of a blender, combine the lemon juice, lime juice, banana liqueur, tequila, triple sec, and bananas. Add ice cubes until the mixture reaches the 6 cup line. Cover and blend until smooth. Pour into margarita glasses to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "We enjoyed banana margaritas while vacationing in Mazatlan Mexico and have been trying to duplicate them every since. This recipe brings back great memories. Serve in salt or sugar rimmed margarita glasses."

Directions: Pour the vodka, triple sec, grenadine, and cranberry juice into a cocktail shaker over ice. Cover, and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain into a chilled martini glass to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is the best drink ever. It tastes just like cherry gelatin, so it's very easy to drink one too many without realizing it. That's how it got it's name!"

Ingredients: 1/2 fluid ounce freshly squeezed lime juice
4 fluid ounces ginger beer, or more to taste
Directions: Combine rum, hibiscus syrup, lime juice, and bitters in a highball glass. Add enough ice to bring liquid volume up halfway; stir to combine. Top mixture with ginger beer.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Bucks refer to drinks that combine lime and ginger beer, so a dark and stormy with lime is an example of a buck. In this version, I introduced aromatic bitters and homemade hibiscus syrup for extra flavor and a blush of color. Add your choice of garnish, such as a lime twist or a fresh hibiscus flower. Serve with a straw."

Directions: Pour cranberry juice into a Champagne flute and top with Champagne. Add a splash of orange liqueur and garnish with rosemary sprig and sugared cranberries.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A wonderful Christmas morning drink with a pink hue that looks lovely when garnished with fresh rosemary sprigs and sugared cranberries."

Directions: Fill a mixing glass with ice. Pour in vodka and sweet vermouth. Stir (or shake) and strain into a martini glass. Splash with blue curacao. Garnish with 3 green olives.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A vodka martini with vermouth and a splash of blue curacao. Looks cool in a martini glass."

Directions: Fill 1/2 a pint glass with pale ale. Slowly fill the remainder of the glass with stout, pouring it slowly over the back side of a spoon to layer it on top.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "The two-toned cocktail includes two great beers--a pale ale and a stout--for the best of both beer worlds."

Ingredients: 1 cup ice cubes, or as needed
2 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers Irish cream liqueur (such as Baileys®)
1/2 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger red cinnamon schnapps
Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice; pour in Irish cream liqueur, butterscotch schnapps, and cinnamon schnapps. Cover the shaker and shake until frothy. Strain into a martini glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "We were at a restaurant one fall, and this drink was on the menu. My brother asked the ingredients, then made multiple iterations at home until he got the recipe just right. The combination sounds odd, but it's delicious!"

Directions: Moisten the edges of a martini glass with a little lime juice, and then dip moistened edges into sugar. Place lemon zest strip in glass.
Combine vodka, lime juice, sweet and sour mix, and ice in a shaker. Shake vigorously, and strain into a martini glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Very elegant, and so easy to make - you will love this lemon and lime vodka drink."

Ingredients: 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger Irish cream liqueur
1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger coffee flavored liqueur
Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Pour in the vodka, Irish cream, butterscotch schnapps and coffee liqueur. Shake well. Strain into shot glasses and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Nice drink or even a shot."

Directions: Pour creme de cassis into large Champagne flute or white wine glass. Top with Champagne.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Named for a popular mayor in post-war France, Kir drinks combine black currant liqueur with various wines. The Kir Royale is named thusly for its use of Champagne."

Directions: Puree cantaloupe, sugar, and champagne vinegar in a blender. Stir in lime zest. Chill, covered, 4 hours to 2 days. Strain.

In a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice, combine 2 fluid ounces cantaloupe shrub, rum, and lime juice. Shake until very cold. Strain into an ice-filled wine glass or water goblet. Garnish with slices of cantaloupe and lime.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This drink starts with a simple shrub--a tart, fruity liquid you make ahead and can also sip straight up or with seltzer."

Ingredients: 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle lemon-lime flavored soda
Directions: Stir cranberry juice and bourbon whiskey together in a small pitcher. Pour lemon-lime soda into pitcher and stir gently.
Put ice into 2 pint-sized tumblers. Pour cranberry juice mixture over the ice.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A refreshing adult beverage."

Directions: Pour the vodka, rum, cranberry juice, and pineapple juice into a cocktail shaker over ice. Cover, and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain into a chilled martini glass to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "The ultimate alcoholic fruit punch."

Directions: Combine some salt and sugar in a small bowl, and pour onto a small, shallow plate. Moisten the rims of 2 glasses with a piece of watermelon, and dip the moistened glass rims into the salt and sugar mixture; set aside.

Pour the watermelon juice, vodka, watermelon schnapps, simple syrup, and lime juice into a cocktail shaker over ice. Cover, and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain into the prepared glasses.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Best summer drink ever!"

Directions: Pour vodka and cranberry juice into a highball glass filled with ice; stir well.
Garnish with a lime wedge.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is the original name for the cocktail commonly referred to as a 'Vodka Cranberry.'"

Directions: Muddle habanero pepper slice and 2 slices fresh ginger together in a cocktail shaker until pulverized, about 20 seconds. Add gin, lime juice, simple syrup, and ice. Cover and shake until well chilled. Strain with a fine mesh strainer into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a thin slice of ginger on a toothpick.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Fresh habanero pepper and ginger root give this gin-based cocktail a spicy kick."

Ingredients: 2 (12 fluid ounce) cans frozen limeade concentrate
Directions: Empty the limeade into a 2 quart pitcher. Using the empty limeade cans, fill each one twice with citrus soda and pour into the pitcher. Fill one limeade can with tequila and pour into the pitcher. Adjust alcohol to personal taste. Mix well and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is a very simple drink to make. It is easier than ever. Everyone I introduce this to wants more, more, MORE!"

Directions: Place 2 sprigs fresh thyme in a cocktail shaker. Add bourbon, Dijon mustard, apple cider, lemon juice, and simple syrup. Fill with ice, cover and shake until chilled. Strain into a large mug or mason jar filled with ice. Garnish with a sprig of fresh thyme.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Apples, thyme, and Dijon mustard are classic flavors to pair with pork chops. Now those ingredients are prepared in a cocktail, but instead of pork, they are combined with bourbon. This is a flavor combination you've gotta try!"

Ingredients: 1 fluid ounce cold club soda, or as needed
Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Pour in gin, half and half, lemon juice, and lime juice. Add sugar, egg white, orange flower water, and vanilla extract. Shake vigorously; rest a second, then shake a little more. Strain into a tall cocktail glass. Top off with club soda.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "When you suspect you're done shaking this creamy gin drink, think again. You've only just begin. Keep shaking. Then shake some more. It's a beautiful cocktail, but you have to shake that juice and cream and egg white like crazy to get the right silky texture. Don't give up, it's worth it!"

cocktails.Recipe Name: Italian Amaretto Margaritas On the Rocks
Directions: Slightly moisten rims of 4 12-ounce glasses and dip in confectioners' sugar to rim the glasses; fill each with crushed ice.
Combine the sweet and sour mix, tequila, amaretto, and orange liqueur in a pitcher; stir. Pour mixture into the prepared glasses. Garnish each drink with orange and lime slices.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is my version of Italian Margaritas. Enjoy!"

Directions: Pour vanilla schnapps into a 4 ounce glass. Fill glass with orange juice and garnish with an orange wedge.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Tastes just like a frozen treat from the icebox...but with a kick! Orange juice mixed with vanilla schnapps."

Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice; add whiskey, vermouth, absinthe, Angostura bitters, and orange bitters. Cover and shake until the outside of shaker has frosted. Strain into a chilled glass and garnish with lemon twist.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A tremendous variation on the Manhattan, with a splash of absinthe and orange bitters."

Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker 1/4 full with ice cubes. Pour in vodka, grapefruit juice, and cranberry juice. Cover and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain into three chilled martini glasses and garnish with a slice of orange.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is not your typical overly-sweet martini. It's very refreshing and a favorite at our Colorado home!"

Ingredients: 1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste
Directions: Stir tomato juice, steak sauce, barbeque sauce, celery seed, garlic salt, and black pepper in a large pitcher. Serve in glasses over ice and garnish each serving with a pinch of cayenne pepper, a lemon wedge, and a celery stick.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "I drink virgin bloody marys for breakfast pretty regularly. To me this is the perfect marriage of flavor for those of you who enjoy this delicious drink. Add alcohol when you're feeling extra zippy."

Directions: Fill a highball glass with ice, and pour in the whiskey, schnapps, amaretto, and milk. Stir and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is a very good drink if you like butterscotch."

Ingredients: 1/2 fluid ounce white creme de menthe
Directions: Combine brandy and creme de menthe in a cocktail shaker. Add ice; cover and shake until chilled. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "There's no sting a cocktail made from crème de menthe and brandy can't heal. Shake up one of these classic cocktails before or after dinner."

Ingredients: 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate
1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate
Directions: Put 7 cups water in large saucepan, and heat on high until boiling. Add sugar and stir until dissolved; set aside to cool. Place tea bags in 2 cups boiling water, and let steep until desired strength is acquired.
In a large bowl, mix together sugar water, tea, lemonade concentrate and orange juice concentrate. Stir in gin. Place in freezer container and freeze overnight.
To serve, Place several scoops into a tall glass, and fill with any clear carbonated beverage.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is a great frozen summer drink that is very thirst quenching! Vodka may be used instead of gin."

Ingredients: 1 fluid ounce sweet and sour mix
Directions: In a cocktail mixer full of ice, combine vodka, melon liqueur and sweet and sour mix. Shake vigorously and strain into glass. Garnish with a cherry.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Not to be confused with the Big Apple Martini, this one tastes just like a green apple Jolly Rancher candy!"
N/A

Directions: Fill a tall glass with ice. Pour in the orange juice followed by the melon liqueur. Stir.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A sweet and refreshing cocktail made with orange juice and melon liqueur. Fruit garnish is optional."

Directions: In a large bowl, beat the eggs and lime zest until light and fluffy using an electric mixer. Mix in the evaporated milk and then the condensed milk. Stir in the nutmeg, rum and bitters. Refrigerate until serving.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Creamy egg rum punch with a pinch of nutmeg and a hint of lime to make a perfect tropical treat."

Ingredients: 6 green olives stuffed with blue cheese
1/4 teaspoon olive juice (adjust to personal taste)
Directions: Gin and glasses must be kept chilled in freezer.
Measure and pour gin into glasses.
Add 1/4 teaspoon olive juice to each glass.
Garnish each glass with 3 speared green olives stuffed with Blue Cheese.
CHEERS!
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "My father and uncle (see 'Dan Fay Martini') loved their martini's. Having sampled both of their recipes, more than once, I found myself making variations to their wonderful concoctions. Here is my latest variation in the tradition of the 'Fay Martini.'"

Ingredients: 1 teaspoon simple syrup (equal parts water and sugar)
Directions: Place 2 thin slices of cucumber in a bowl with basil leaves and sugar and smash with a fork until softened; pour in a teaspoon of watermelon vodka to loosen the mixture. Place crushed ice into a cocktail shaker and transfer cucumber-basil mixture into shaker; top with remaining watermelon vodka, lime juice, and simple syrup. Shake and strain into 2 chilled martini glasses; garnish each cocktail with 1 slice of peeled cucumber. Best enjoyed wearing flip-flops.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "My summer garden inspired me to venture into my cocktail laboratory to concoct this chic, fashionable summer martini. Best enjoyed wearing flip-flops. (Warning: More than one may cause misplaced flip-flops.)"

Ingredients: 1 cup ice cubes, or as needed
1/2 cup carbonated water, or as needed
Directions: Put 3 mint leaves and 2 teaspoons sugar into each of 2 glass tumblers; vigorously stir sugar and mint together, crushing mint with the back of a spoon to release oils. Add 3 lime wedges to each glass; again stir vigorously to release some lime juice. Pour 1 jigger rum into each glass. Fill glasses with ice cubes and top with carbonated water; stir.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Trial and error pay off! Time-consuming, but so worth it."

Directions: In a blender, combine limeade concentrate, ice cubes, water and vodka. Blend until smooth. Pour into 6 ounce stem glasses, and garnish with lime slices.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Using a small can of limeade, ice and either vodka or gin, you can create the perfect aid for a long week."

Directions: Pour the vodka, chocolate liqueur, coffee liqueur, and schnapps into a cocktail shaker over ice. Cover, and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain into a chilled martini glass to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "An exquisite after-dinner cocktail. Potent and spicy notes going down with a nice long, cooling dark chocolate finish. Styled after some Mexican chocolate cupcakes I adore, and the more traditional Mexican hot chocolate. The key to any great martini is good liquor, use the best you have and you won't be disappointed."

Directions: In a blender, combine rum cream liqueur, coffee liqueur, milk and strawberry syrup. Add the banana and crushed ice. Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "An alcoholic drink served in Jamaica. Contains rum cream liqueur, coffee liqueur, strawberry syrup, banana, and milk and ends up having a smoothie consistency."

Ingredients: 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger grapefruit vodka (such as Absolut Ruby Red®)
Directions: Combine grapefruit vodka, grapefruit juice, and cranberry juice in an ice-filled cocktail shaker. Shake and strain cocktail into a martini glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A tasty drink to take the edge off the cold winter nights."

Ingredients: 3 fluid ounces sweet and sour mix
Directions: Pour the rum, sweet and sour mix, lime juice, and coconut syrup into the pitcher of a blender; drop in the ice cubes and blend to a slushy consistency. Pour into a glass to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Can't decide between sweet or sour? This rum squeeze might be the answer. It is a slurpy cocktail with a kick, a perfect complement to any sunset."

Directions: Pour the rum, schnapps, and grenadine into a cocktail shaker over ice. Cover, and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain into a chilled martini glass, and garnish with the candy cane to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Just the thing for a Holiday party. If you can find red and white sugar to rim the glass, it makes this drink really pretty!"

Ingredients: 1/4 fluid ounce sweet and sour mix
Directions: Fill a highball glass with ice cubes. Pour in the rum, tequila, gin, blue curacao, vodka, sour mix, and cola. Do not stir, allow the liquors to remain layered! Garnish with a lime wedge to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This Long Island will knock you down!"

Ingredients: 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger cinnamon whiskey (such as Fireball®)
1/2 fluid ounce spiced rum (such as Captain Morgan's®)
4 fluid ounces cola-flavored carbonated beverage, or as needed
Directions: Pour whiskey and rum into a high ball glass; stir well. Top drink with cola.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "I have recently found a love for mixology and experimenting with new and wild alcohol flavors. Substitute diet soda if desired."

Directions: Mix water and sugar together in a 2-quart pitcher until dissolved.
Stir lime juice, lemon juice, and orange juice into pitcher. Add tequila and triple sec; stir.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A fantastic margarita without a mix. The better the alcohol, the smoother the taste (that goes without saying), but these are pretty fabulous with even fairly cheap tequila and triple sec! Serve over ice for margaritas on the rocks or make several hours ahead and freeze for amazing margarita slushies!"

Directions: In a glass full of ice, pour Southern Comfort and cinnamon schnapps. Fill glass with Cola.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "HEY! Don't drink too many of these! Southern Comfort and cinnamon schnapps mixed with cola."

Ingredients: 1 ounce Irish cream liqueur (such as Bailey's®)
Directions: Combine amaretto, molasses, allspice, and pumpkin pie spice in a small saucepan over medium heat and cook until molasses is melted. Remove from heat and allow to cool briefly, 5 to 10 minutes
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice and add vodka, Irish cream liqueur, and amaretto mixture. Shake well to blend and strain into a cocktail glass. Serve with gingersnap cookies.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "The combination of amaretto, vodka, and Bailey's Irish Cream® will add joy to your festivities. Enjoy the holidays with this cocktail brimming with the warming spices of the season."

Ingredients: 2 fluid ounces sour apple schnapps (such as DeKuyper® Sour Apple Pucker)
Directions: Pour the butterscotch schnapps, vodka, apple schnapps, and cranberry juice into a cocktail shaker over ice. Cover, and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain into a chilled martini glass to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "It's not tart, it's soooo smooth and sweet!"

Ingredients: 1 1/2 fluid ounces frozen limeade concentrate, thawed
Directions: Place the lime wedges in the bottom of a mixing glass and muddle them well. Cover with ice, and pour in vodka, lime juice, and vanilla. Shake well, then strain into two stemmed cocktail glasses. Garnish each with a twist of lime.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "It tastes just like the pie, minus the crust (now if they would just invent a graham cracker flavored liqueur...)."

Ingredients: 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger vanilla flavored vodka
1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger creme de cacao
1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger coffee flavored liqueur
Directions: Pour the vodka, creme de cacao, and coffee liqueur into a cocktail shaker over ice. Cover, and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain into a chilled martini glass to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Smooooooooooth chocolate martini."

Ingredients: 4 fluid ounces lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage
Directions: Place the ice into a tall glass. Pour in the vodka, lemonade, and lemon-lime beverage. Garnish with a lemon wedge to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "An easy to make summer mixer with a refreshing taste."

Directions: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes. Pour in red wine and cola; garnish with a slice of lemon.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "When I was living in the Basque region of Spain, this was a traditional drink served everywhere. It is pronounced 'Cali-mot-cho' and is traditionally served over ice with a slice of lemon."

Directions: Combine the water, lime juice, tequila, and cointreau in a half-gallon pitcher. Stir to mix.
To serve, rub the rim of a margarita glass with lime, and dip in salt. Fill the glass with ice, and top with the tequila mixture. Garnish with a slice of lime.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is my husband's secret recipe from Austin Texas. We always serve this to our favorite friends. A very straightforward margarita with no added sugar."

Ingredients: 3/4 teaspoon hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®)
Directions: Stir tomato juice, vodka, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, horseradish, hot pepper sauce, celery salt, and black pepper together in a pitcher.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is the ultimate bloody mary! After several tries and a few not-so-good-next-mornings, I perfected this yummy concoction! Serve chilled with big green olives and/or celery stalks and a smile! Try pepper-infused vodka for an even spicier concoction."

Directions: Pour the vodka, triple sec, limoncello, lemon juice, and lime juice into a cocktail shaker over ice. Cover, and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain into a chilled martini glass, and garnish with a twist of lemon to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A delicious Italian version of a Kamikaze using limoncello liqueur."

Ingredients: 16 fluid ounces white creme de cacao
Directions: Mix schnapps, creme de cacao, half-and-half, and grenadine together in a pitcher; refrigerate until chilled, at least 1 hour.
Stir mixture before pouring into martini glasses to serve; garnish each glass with a candy cane.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A holiday drink everyone seems to enjoy! I always am asked for the recipe!"

Ingredients: 1 teaspoon hot pepper sauce (such as Frank's RedHot®)
Directions: In a large pitcher, stir together the Bloody Mary mix, horseradish, dill, hot pepper sauce, and dill pickle juice. Taste and adjust seasoning if desired.

In a shallow dish, stir together the kosher salt, pepper and celery seed. Pour the lime juice onto a saucer. Dip each glass into the lime juice to coat the rim, then into the spice mixture. Fill each glass with ice. Pour one shot of vodka into each glass if using. Fill with the Bloody Mary mixture. Garnish each glass with a wedge of lime and a dill pickle spear.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Bloody Marys are perfect for that Sunday morning brunch. This can also be served as a virgin bloody Mary (minus the vodka)."

Ingredients: 1/2 fluid ounce melon liqueur (such as Midori®)
Directions: Fill a collins glass with ice, and pour in the vodka, raspberry schnapps, melon liqueur, and splash of lime juice. Pour in the sour mix until the glass is 2/3 full and top off the glass with the soda water. Stir gently to mix, then add a splash of grenadine to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A tasty drink for any party - but best for Halloween! Great for one, but multiply it out for a punch."

cocktails.Recipe Name: Orange Crush! Fresh Squeezed Orange and Vodka Cocktail
Ingredients: 2 cups ice cubes, or as needed
Directions: Fill a pint glass with ice cubes. Pour orange-flavored vodka, triple sec, and orange juice over ice; top with lemon-lime soda. Mix well and garnish with orange slice.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "It's vitamin C with a smile! This beverage is yummy any time of year! It's the perfect drink on a hot summer day, BBQ cookout, as well as Sunday football and/or your next New Year's party. Whatever the occasion, this drink is a fresh beverage crowd pleaser. Without a doubt, my press juicer gets a workout when friends and family come over. Just give it a try!"

Directions: Place ice cubes, pisco, lemon juice, sugar, egg white, and bitters in the bowl of a blender. Blend on high speed until finely pureed. Pour into two glasses and garnish with an additional dash of bitters.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Pisco is a style of brandy common to Peru and Chile which has a bit of a tequila flavor. The egg white gives this tangy drink a smooth, full body. Don't forget the bitters, they're the secret ingredient!"

Ingredients: 32 fluid ounces cold lemon-lime flavored soda
3/4 cup peach-flavored bourbon liqueur (such as Southern Comfort ®)
Directions: Combine orange juice, lemon juice, and sugar in a pitcher; stir until the sugar is dissolved. Cover pitcher with plastic wrap. Chill in refrigerator 15 minutes. Add the lemon-lime soda and the bourbon liqueur. Serve over ice.
Refrigerate until chilled, about 15 minutes. Gently stir lemon-lime soda and bourbon liqueur into the orange juice mixture. Pour into cups filled with ice to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "I made this for New Year's Eve and it was so good. I couldn't even taste the alcohol in it."

Ingredients: 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen limeade concentrate
1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle lemon-lime soda (such as Sprite®)
1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle Mexican beer
Directions: Mix limeade, tequila, lemon-lime soda, and beer together in a pitcher.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "It's called riverbank margaritas because you can carry everything you need to the riverbank! Very tasty! You can have it on the rocks or we sometimes put it in resealable bags in the freezer and it becomes slushy."

Ingredients: 1/4 teaspoon absinthe (or a substitute, such as Pernod®)
Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice; add whiskey, vermouth, cherry brandy, and absinthe. Shake or stir; pour into a chilled martini glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This one takes the Manhattan as inspiration and adds cherry brandy and a splash of absinthe -- and loses the maraschino cherry."

Ingredients: 4 fluid ounces Puerto Rican white rum
Directions: Place 4 ice cubes in each 6-ounce glass. Pour 2 ounces of Puerto Rican white rum in each glass. Squeeze the juice of 1/4 of lemon in each glass. Pour in 3 ounces of cranberry juice. Stir.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is a refreshing summer drink you can enjoy all year long. My husband and I love to have one every day after working out at the gym! Be sure to use fresh lemon juice!"

Ingredients: 3/4 fluid ounce Cointreau or other orange liqueur
3/4 fluid ounce sweet and sour mix
Directions: Pour the vodka, Cointreau, orange juice, and sweet and sour mix into a cocktail shaker over ice. Cover, and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass over crushed ice to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Use a French accent when pronouncing the 'range.' I made this drink by accident - I was in the middle of mixing up a Cosmopolitan when I discovered I was out of cranberry juice. Very refreshing!"

Ingredients: 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger coconut flavored rum
3 1/2 fluid ounces guava flavored juice cocktail
Directions: Pour rum over ice in a highball glass. Fill the glass with guava juice cocktail; stir. Drizzle the grenadine syrup over the top.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This colorful and refreshing beverage of coconut rum, guava juice cocktail, and grenadine, recalls the dawn and rising tide along Cape Cod."

Ingredients: 1 1/4 fluid ounces raspberry-flavored vodka (such as Smirnoff®)
Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice and pour in lemon-lime soda, vodka, and triple sec. Cover, shake, and strain cocktail into martini glass. Garnish with a cherry.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A strong fruity mixed drink."

Directions: Fill 4 margarita glasses each with 1/2 cup ice.
Blend triple sec, tequila, and lime juice together in a blender; pour into the prepared margarita glasses.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A different margarita, so smooth you can't do two. Drink slowly and responsibly. Dip the rim of the glass in equal parts white sugar and salt if desired."

Ingredients: 2 fluid ounces pomegranate vodka (such as Van Gogh®)
Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice; add pomegranate vodka, peach schnapps, and orange juice. Cover and shake vigorously for 5 seconds. Strain into a chilled martini glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is a delicious martini during the holidays or really any time."

Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice; pour the vodka, cranberry juice, and pineapple juice over the ice; shake vigorously; strain into a chilled martini glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This recipe makes a wonderfully fruity martini! Garnish with a cherry or fresh pineapple wedge. "

Directions: Fill a pitcher with ice, and pour in the tequila, gin, rum, vodka, triple sec, orange juice, and grenadine. Stir to mix, then pour in beer to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "VERY STRONG drink - Similar to Long Island Iced Tea, but tastes much better to me, you don't taste the alcohol. You can adjust orange juice amount to adjust taste. Remember DO NOT drink and drive... This is a VERY strong drink but you don't taste the alcohol... fruity taste."

Ingredients: 2 ounces wheat whiskey (such as Dry Fly®)
Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Pour whiskey and vermouth over ice and add bitters; gently stir with a long spoon. Strain whiskey mixture into a cocktail glass. Rub mandarin zest along the rim of the cocktail glass and drop into the drink along with the cherries.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is the perfect drink to serve to the Seahawks fan in your life! When a cocktail just isn't enough, try a Hawktail!"

cocktails.Recipe Name: Frozen Pineapple Upside Down Cake Martini
Directions: Blend sherbet, pineapple juice, vodka, and schnapps in a blender until well combined, 10 to 15 seconds.
Pour a splash of grenadine into 4 martini glasses. Pour drink mixture into each glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A fun and delicious drink. Add more alcohol if you'd like!"

Directions: Combine gingerade, tequila, and lime juice in a cocktail shaker; serve over ice.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Impress your guests with this exciting new twist on a Cadillac Margarita. So delicious and refreshing! You can garnish with a lime wedge."

Directions: Fill a highball glass with ice cubes. Pour on rum, vermouth and banana liqueur. Stir.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This is an alcoholic drink I enjoyed at the Oriental Hotel in Bangkok during my honeymoon. It's made with rum and banana liqueur."

Directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice and pour in Calvados, Chartreuse, and Benedictine(R). Shake in bitters and stir. Strain into a chilled martini glass and garnish with a cherry.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A great fall cocktail if there ever was one. Calvados mixes with Chartreuse, Benedictine®, and bitters."

Directions: Place less than a drop of Monin Raspberry Syrup in the bottom of a Martini glass.
Add Stoli Razberi, Triple Sec, white cranberry juice, and a squeeze of lime into an ice-filled shaker and shake vigorously. Strain and pour mixture into martini glass. Garnish with 3 raspberries.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Shaken, not stirred, is the way to make this raspberrilicious concoction made with Stoli Razberi, raspberry syrup, white cranberry juice, and a touch of lime, and garnished with three fresh raspberries."

Directions: Pour peach juice into a champagne flute. Slowly pour sparkling wine over peach juice; let sit until liquids have blended, about 1 minute. Pour raspberry juice over champagne mixture.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "The Bellini was created in the late 1930s to early 1940s by Guiseppe Cipriani at the legendary Harry's Bar in Venice, a favorite hangout for expats including Ernest Hemingway, Sinclair Lewis, and Orson Welles. The fruity cocktail owes its name and color to Cipriani's fascination with Giovanni Bellini, a 15th-century Venetian artist. Originally prepared with Prosecco and white peach puree, it's perfectly acceptable to use yellow peach puree or prepared peach nectar and/or peach schnapps. Sip and feel sophisticated!"

Ingredients: 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger good quality vodka
6 fluid ounces pulp-free pure premium orange juice
Directions: Pour the orange juice into a glass with ice, then pour in the shot of vodka. Stir and serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Ok, a screwdriver is simple enough, but oh wow, if you use the right ingredients... I use Grey Goose Vodka and premium pulp-free orange juice and it really makes a difference."

Directions: Place the ice, tequila, lime juice, triple sec, avocado, and cilantro into a blender, and blend until smooth. Pour into salt-rimmed margarita glasses to serve.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Frozen margaritas with avocado. Very sweet and smooth."

Ingredients: 1 (3 ounce) package green apple flavored Jell-O® mix
Directions: Dissolve the gelatin mix in boiling water, stirring for about 2 minutes. Stir in the cold water and schnapps and pour into shot sized disposable cups. Refrigerate until firm, about 3 hours.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Green apple gelatin mixed with cinnamon schnapps becomes a delicious shot, great for the holidays."

Directions: Combine vodka, lime juice, triple sec, and cranberry juice in a cocktail shaker. Add ice, cover and shake until chilled. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lime wedge.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "The cosmopolitan, typically referred to as the 'cosmo,' gained popularity during the 1990s when it was frequently mentioned on the television show Sex and the City. The combination of vodka, orange liqueur, lime juice, and cranberry juice have made it a timeless classic."

Ingredients: 2 tablespoons white sugar, or to taste
Directions: Combine the cantaloupe, gin, sugar and ice in a blender, and blend until the ice is smooth. You may need to do two batches if your blender is small. Pour into tall glasses and serve immediately.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A delicious blended ice drink of cantaloupe and gin. This made me one BIG all night drink but divide into 2 or 4 as desired. Of course you can adjust everything to your liking and blender size. Make sure to use the juiciest and ripest fruit you can get."

Ingredients: 1 (3 ounce) package lemon-flavored gelatin mix (such as Jell-O®)
1 (3 ounce) package orange-flavored gelatin mix (such as Jell-O®)
Directions: Pour 3/4 cup boiling water into a small bowl. Add lemon gelatin mix; stir until dissolved. Pour 1 cup vodka into a glass measuring cup; add enough ice to make 1 1/4 cup. Stir into lemon gelatin until slightly thickened; remove any unmelted ice. Fill tall shot glasses 1/3 of the way with lemon gelatin mixture.
Refrigerate until lemon gelatin layer is set, at least 90 minutes.

Pour remaining 3/4 cup boiling water into the small bowl. Add orange gelatin mix; stir until dissolved. Pour remaining 1 cup vodka into a glass measuring cup; add enough ice to make 1 1/4 cup. Stir into orange gelatin until slightly thickened; remove any unmelted ice. Pour over lemon gelatin layer.
Refrigerate until orange gelatin layer is set, at least 90 minutes.
Pour 2 tablespoons warm water into a bowl. Add unflavored gelatin; stir until dissolved. Stir in condensed milk and rum. Pour over orange gelatin layer.
Refrigerate until top layer is set, at least 30 minutes.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "The seasonal treat that inspires strong feelings - love 'em or hate 'em - in a boozy shot form. This version goes for a triple shot, so shoot responsibly. Serve with candy corn on the side. Cheers!"

Directions: Combine rye and tea leaves together in a small bowl until rye is infused, about 15 minutes. Strain tea leaves from rye.
Place ice in a cocktail shaker; add infused whiskey and tawny port wine. Cover shaker and shake for 20 seconds; strain into a cocktail glass.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This smoky cocktail combines spice and sweetness - wow!"

Directions: Lightly moisten the mint sprig and sprinkle with sugar. Set aside.

Fill a Collins glass with ice. Pour in orange juice, lime juice, lemon juice, and pineapple juice. Stir until the glass is frosted. Add light rum and Jamaican rum; stir until combined. Top with triple sec and grenadine. Garnish with slices of orange, lemon, pineapple, maraschino cherry, and the sugar-dipped spring of mint. Serve with a straw.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This tropical cocktail is refreshing like the ocean breeze. The mixture of rum and fruit juices will transport you to an sandy beach."

Directions: In a cocktail shaker, shake together vodka, hazelnut liqueur, Irish cream liqueur, and coffee flavored liqueur with several cubes of ice. Strain into a glass filled with ice cubes.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "This splendid mixture of liquors that everyone has in the back of their liquor cabinet collecting dust looks like chocolate milk, but is far from it. My friends and I came up with it one night when we did not have the right ingredients for another drink. All of our ladies said that it should be a regular drink at all our parties."

Ingredients: 4 fluid ounces amaretto liqueur, plus additional
Directions: Dip the rims of 4 margarita glasses in amaretto, then into sugar; set aside. Pour the limeaid, tequila, amaretto, orange juice, and ice into the bowl of a blender. Puree until smooth, then pour into prepared glasses.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Amaretto gives this drink a fun twist! Frosty glasses rimmed with amaretto and sugar make this drink even better."

Directions: Pour Pimm's into pint glass, fill with ice. Top with ginger-ale. Garnish with a slice of lemon and a slice of cucumber.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "Pimm's No. 1 liqueur is the key to this refreshing cocktail with British origins. It's the unofficial drink of the tennis tournament Wimbledon."

Ingredients: 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger orange liqueur (Cointreau, Triple Sec or Grand Marnier)
Directions: Slightly moisten rim of a large martini glass, and dip in course salt to rim the glass.
Combine tequila, orange liqueur, sweet and sour mix, orange juice, and ice in a shaker. Shake vigorously, and strain into martini glass. Garnish with jalapeno-stuffed green olives.
cocktails.Chef Remarks: "A unique way to make a margarita. Be careful! These are known to be potent!"

Ingredients: 1/4 cup apple cider, or as needed
